activityName: Polyvinylchloride, suspension polymerised {RER}| polyvinylchloride production, suspension polymerisation | Cut-off, S - Copied from Ecoinvent U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.
original ecoinvent name: Polyvinylchloride, suspension polymerised {RER}| polyvinylchloride production, suspension polymerisation | Cut-off, S

The dataset represents the production mix of commercial S-PVC production technologies

Polyvinyl chloride (PVC) is manufactured by polymerisation of vinyl chloride monomer (VCM). Polymerisation of PVC is an exothermic reaction. The pressure in the reactor is usually in the range of 0.4 - 1.2 MPa and the reaction temperature is between 35 - 70°C. During the polymerisation reaction 85 - 97% of the VCM is converted into PVC. Residual VCM is removed by stripping the polymer suspension or latex. The unreacted monomer is recovered, liquefied, and returned to polymerisation

For the polymerisation process certain process chemicals are required. Surfactants, emulsifiers and protective colloids are used to prepare and stabilize the dispersion of monomer and PVC in process water (typically around 1 kg/t VCM in suspension and around 10-20 kg/t in emulsion). Organic peroxides or peresters are used as initiators (typically 1 kg/t VCM) for the production of suspension and microsuspension PVC, while e.g. hindered phenols are used to stop the reaction (typically < 1 kg/t VCM). For the production of emulsion PVC inorganic peroxides are common.

PVC resin resulting from the suspension process (S-PVC) has a mean particle size of 50 - 200 µm. The essential differences between S-PVC grades result from the average length of polymer chains and from the porosity of the particles. Suspension PVC is always produced batch wise in a stirred vessel. The monomer is dispersed in demineralised water by the combination of mechanical stirring and surfactants. The polymerisation takes place inside the VCM droplets under the influence of VCM soluble initiators such as peresters, percarbonates, or peroxides.

Production volume: 3400000000 kg
Included activities start: Acitivity starts with monomers entering the polymerisation plant. Energy supply is included in terms of heat production inside the battery limits of the plant. Steam and electricity supply is outside the activity.
Included activities end: Activity ends with polymer granulate leaving the factory.
Energy values: Undefined
Geography: The inventory is modelled for Europe
Technology level: Current
Technology: Coverage of production capacity in Europe: 88%
Start date: 01/01/2013
End date: 31/12/2022
Is data valid for entire period: True
Time period: Data was collected for the year 2013, processed in 2014 and published in 2015
Macro-economic scenario name: Business-as-Usual

activityName: White asparagus {FR}| white asparagus production | Cut-off, U - Copied from Ecoinvent U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.
original ecoinvent name: White asparagus {FR}| white asparagus production | Cut-off, U

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of asparagus. The average Yield_ from 2009 - 2012 is 4.2 t/ha. The data are representative for asparagus production in France. Mineral NPK fertiliser input is 110-50-150 kg/ha. Organic fertilisers applied amount to 0.19 m3/ha of liquid manure and 0.15 t/ha of solid manure. Total active ingredients (a.i.) applied as pesticides amount to 5.66 kg a.i./ha.

The dataset was modelled within the project 'World Food LCA database (WFLDB)'. The aim of this project was to provide inventories of a broad variety of agricultural products and processes and to cover for each product at least 50% of the global export market. The share of asparagus produced in France amounts to 0.2% of the global production (tonnage produced in 2010). The production system regarded in this dataset aimed at representing asparagus produced in France for the export market.

PEF-Quality: data quality rating (DQR) = 1.3 (i.e. excellent quality). This dataset refers to an average situation; for specific situations exchanges might differ substantially due to site specific parameters

Production volume: 20012250 kg
Included activities start: This activity starts with the nursery producing asparagus crown (seedlings).
Included activities end: This activity ends with the removal of asparagus roots after the productive phase (7 years). The dataset includes all activities of a year in a year in the productive phase of the asparagus field including the establishment phase (2 years) per year of lifetime (9 years). 
The establishment phase of the asparagus field includes the nursery, manual planting, soil cultivation (plough), fertilisation (manure) and PE foil. 
The productive phase of the asparagus field includes machine operations, corresponding infrastructure, fuel use and sheds. Machine operations in the productive phase are: soil cultivation, fertiliser and pesticide application, manual harvesting and irrigation. Further, direct field emissions and land use change are included. At the end of the productive phase the field is cleared by removing the asparagus roots.
Heavy metal uptake by the crop is considered.
The inputs of asparagus crowns (seedlings), fertilisers and pesticides as well as packaging of fertilisers and pesticides are considered. The dataset doesn't include emissions from manure storage because these are within the system boundary of animal production.
Energy values: Undefined
Geography: The inventory is modelled for France
Technology level: Current
Technology: Conventional production
Start date: 01/01/2009
End date: 31/12/2022
Is data valid for entire period: True
Time period: 
Macro-economic scenario name: Business-as-Usual

activityName: Lemon, at farm (WFLDB)
comment:
Translated name: Lemon, at farm (WFLDB 3.5)
Included processes: The inventory includes all activities of a year in the productive phase of the orchard, i.e. fertiliser and pesticide application, soil cultivation, harvesting and irrigation. Machine infrastructure including a shed for shelter and fuel use are also considered as well as transport on the farm. Direct field emissions from crop production activities and from land use change are considered. The establishment phase of the orchard, i.e. tree nursery, soil cultivation, planting trees, sowing grass and irrigation. Fertiliser and pesticide use in a year of the establishment phase is assumed to be half of the amount of a year in the productive phase. 
Remark: The functional unit is the production of 1 kg of lemons. The reference flow is the average yield per ha and year for the reference period of 2009 - 2012: yield (13.8 t/ha) obtained under irrigated conditions (total amount of water 6212 m3/ha). System boundary: an average year of the productive phase is regarded; included are also the per year of lifetime calculated emissions for nursery, materials for planting, establishment and clearing phase; at farm without storage. Number of years from planting to clearing (lifetime): 30 years   - Waste treatment after clearing of the orchard: Wooden posts and tree wood go to incineration, concrete posts go to land fill, iron wires go to recycling. The data are representative for lemon production in Mexico based on average data.

Data quality rating (DQR) = 3.0 (i.e. good quality)

activityName: Olive {ES}| olive production | Cut-off, U - Adapted from Ecoinvent U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.
original ecoinvent name: Olive {ES}| olive production | Cut-off, U

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of olives. The average Yield_ from 2009 - 2012 is 5 t/ha. The data are representative for olive production in Spain (Andalusia) used for the export market. Mineral NPK fertiliser input is 60-60-60 kg/ha. No organic fertilisers are applied. Total active ingredients (a.i.) applied as pesticides amount to 2.15 kg a.i./ha.

The dataset was modelled within the project 'World Food LCA database (WFLDB)'. The aim of this project was to provide inventories of a broad variety of agricultural products and processes and to cover for each product at least 50% of the global export market. The share of olives produced in Spain amounts to 37% of the global production (tonnage produced in 2010). The production system regarded in this dataset aimed at representing olives produced in Spain for the export market.

PEF-Quality: data quality rating (DQR) = 1.5 (i.e. excellent quality). This dataset refers to an average situation; for specific situations exchanges might differ substantially due to site specific parameters

Production volume: 6459754496 kg
Included activities start: This activity starts with the nursery producing fruit tree seedlings, i.e. grafted young trees to be planted.
Included activities end: This activity ends with the waste treatment after the clearing of the orchard (rooting up the trees). The dataset includes all activities of a year in a year in the productive phase of the orchard including the establishment phase per year of lifetime (40 years, 250 trees/ha planted), the clearing of the orchard including waste treatment. 
The establishment phase of the orchard includes tree nursery, soil cultivation, planting trees, sowing grass, and irrigation. Fertiliser and pesticide use in a year of the establishment phase is assumed to be half of the amount of a year in the productive phase.
The productive phase of the orchard includes machine operations, corresponding infrastructure, fuel use and sheds. Machine operations in the productive phase are: soil cultivation (mulching, mowing), fertiliser and pesticide application, harvesting and irrigation. Further, direct field emissions and land use change are included. At the end of the productive phase the orchard is cleared by rooting up the trees.
Heavy metal uptake by the crop is considered. The inputs of seedlings, fertilisers and pesticides as well as packaging of fertilisers and pesticides are considered.
Energy values: Undefined
Geography: The inventory is modelled for Spain
Technology level: Current
Technology: Conventional production
Start date: 01/01/2009
End date: 31/12/2022
Is data valid for entire period: True
Time period: 
Macro-economic scenario name: Business-as-Usual

activityName: Ice cream cone, 402g | Packaging System, Proxy Pack, Cardboard {FR} U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.

The inventory includes : (1) only the main packaging material (in contact with the product) ; (2) the transport for packaging supply (ratio FR and ratio RER) ; (3) only the main process ; (4) the end of life of the main packaging material.

Functional unit: 1kg of packaged food product

The packaging solutions mentioned as PROXY PACK have been developed with a simplified approach but are based on datasets from PACK-AGB project. These datasets have not been developed for use in comparative LCAs of packaging solutions: if this is your purpose, we recommend that you follow the ADEME reference framework on comparative comparative LCA between different packaging solutions: https://librairie.ademe.fr/dechets-economie-circulaire/5309-cadre-de-reference-acv-comparatives-entre-differentes-solutions-d-emballages.html

Overall data quality : DQR= 2,5; Technological representativeness (TeR) = 2; Geographical representativeness (GR) = 2; Time-related representativeness (TiR) = 5; Precision (P material) = 1; Precision (P processing) = 1

Time period: Inventory data based on 2023 " Plein Pot Sur les Emballages " (PPSE) data (data from ADEME and Open Food Facts)

Use of "PPSE" data to improve packaging modelling for products not covered by the "PACK AGB" project. Data verified by CTCPA's packaging expert.

General assumptions

For "PPSE" missing data, assumptions are based on CTCPA expertise 
Some multi-layer packaging (identified by CTCPA's expert) are modeled using a packaging solution from PACK AGB project. Nota bene the packaging format may be different.

Assumptions at each stage: 

Production
- Only the packaging material in contact with the product or ensuring the product's shelf life is modeled.
For example, in the case of cookies packaged in PP plastic bags (element 1), themselves packaged in a cardboard box (elements 2): (i) Element 2 is the heaviest / (ii) Element 1 is in contact with the product, so the PP material was taken into account.
- For multi-element and multi-layer packaging, the inventory calls for the material in contact with the product and for the quantity, an assumption has been made to take of the packaging solution (sum of all elements) and consider this value for this material.
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative material.

Processing
- Only the most representative process for the most representative packaging material is included.
For example, in the case of a multi-layer flexible film, only the extrusion process is modeled. The lamination process used to combine the various packaging layers was not included. 
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used for the most representative process.

Transport
- The assumptions of the PACK AGB project were applied
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material
- Ratios from France and Europe compiled in the PACK AGB project by packaging material were used (ADEME data, 2020).

End of life
- All plastic packaging is considered non-recycled (R2=0%).
To be able to affirm that the plastic packaging is recycled, it is necessary to consider the whole packaging solution (with all the elements and materials) and in this project the dataset only include a part of the packaging (proxy)
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material. 
- The Circular FootPrint Formula was applied.

Vérificateurs : CTCPA (packaging expert from CTCPA)
Contact : Pauline AUDOYE (paudoye@ctcpa.org) ; Mathilde BRAMBATI (mbrambati@ctcpa.org) ; Margaux COLOMBIN(mcolombin@ctcpa.org)

activityName: Beef and veal, 244g | Packaging System, N0, All, Tray in a metallic plastic bag {FR} U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.

N0, all Identification key for packaging system containing one or more element.
For more information, please refer to the methodological report  : Colombin, M., Audoye, P., Farrant, L., Allain, D., Anneraud, C., Bosque, F., Besnier, A., Bozec, A.(2024). Rapport méthodologique : volet emballages Agribalyse 3.2.

The inventory refers to a "tray in a metallic plastic bag" and the associated elements allowing to condition a weight between 190 and 310g of beef or veal. 
Application to other cases: This inventory of packaging solution can only be used for products in sub-category "Beef and veal" (PACK_AGB) : refer to the report for more details. This inventory cannot be used to represent the same type of packaging for other products outside the sub-category "Beef and veal" (PACK_AGB).

The data was produced from study of packaging on the French market (supermarket reference), weighing of two references and CTCPA packaging expertise.
Three references were weighed to best represent the French market. They are all marketed under own brand.
The weight of 244g of product used was obtained by averaging three references of 194g, 234g and 304g. The weight of the packaging corresponds to the average of the weighed packaging.

The inventory includes : (1) production of packaging materials***, (2) manufacture and finishing of packaging components, (3) intermediate transport from the production of materials to the packaging site, and (4) the end-of-life management of packaging*** as it takes place in France. ***Application of CCF, rate of virgin and recycled materials corresponding to the FR scenario (2022) 
The inventory does not include distribution transport (integrated into the next stage at distribution in AGRIBALYSE).

The packaging solutions developed as part of the PACK_AGB project have not been developed for use in comparative LCAs of packaging solutions: if this is your purpose, we recommend that you follow the ADEME reference framework on comparative comparative LCA between different packaging solutions: https://librairie.ademe.fr/dechets-economie-circulaire/5309-cadre-de-reference-acv-comparatives-entre-differentes-solutions-d-emballages.html .

Overall data quality : DQR= 1,25; Technological representativeness (TeR) = 1; Geographical representativeness (GR) = 2; Time-related representativeness (TiR) = 1; Precision (P material) = 1; Precision (P processing) = 1
Time period: the data describing the packaging solution was collected over the period 2020-2022. 
The inventory is modelled for France. Packaging waste management is representative of packaging waste management in France. 
Property rights : OpenData, licence "Ecolab".  
Property data : ADEME

activityName: Packaging glass, white {RER w/o CH+DE}| production | Cut-off, S - Copied from Ecoinvent U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.
original ecoinvent name: Packaging glass, white {RER w/o CH+DE}| packaging glass production, white | Cut-off, S

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of white packaging glass from a mix of primary and secondary raw materials.

[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

CO2 emissions have been recalculated from the carbon content in raw materials and fuels.

Material inputs are estimation based on literature sources and a Swiss production site. Energy and water consumption, emissions, and waste production are estimation based on literature sources. Infrastructure is an estimation based on average European packaging glass factories.

Production volume: 12807795712 kg
Included activities start: From the reception of precursors silica sand, soda, unsorted glass cullets, limestone, dolomite, feldspar, and chemicals  inorganics at the factory gate.
Included activities end: This activity ends with the production of 1 kg of white packaging glass. The dataset includes material and energy inputs, water consumption, emissions to air and water, waste production, transport and infrastructure.
Energy values: Undefined
Geography: The inventory is modelled for Europe without Germany and Switzerland
Technology level: Old
Technology: Packaging glass is produced in a two stage moulding process with pressing and blowing techniques. The whole process is fully automatic and consists of five different stages:

None

1.	Production of a molten glass piece (gob) with correct weight and temperature. 

None

None

2.	Forming of the primary shape in a first mould (blank mould) with compressed air pressure

None

3.	Transfer to the final mould (finish mould)

None

4.	Bringing the shaping process to an end by blowing the container with compressed air until the shape of the final mould

None

5.	Post forming processes

The melting process is the central one. As the first glass forming material, sand, has a very high melting point. Soda as a fluxing agent is used to reduce the melting temperature. When heating soda, this is decomposed into sodium oxide Na2O, the actual fluxing agent, and into carbon dioxide that is released. Metal oxides in form of limestone (CaCO3 that decomposes to CaO), dolomite (-> Ca- and Mg-Oxides), feldspar are used as stabilizators and therefore to improve the hardness and chemical resistance of glass. For white glass  decolouring agents are added.
Start date: 01/01/2000
End date: 31/12/2022
Is data valid for entire period: True

activityName: Polyethylene terephthalate, granulate, bottle grade {RER}| production | Cut-off, S - Copied from Ecoinvent U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.
original ecoinvent name: Polyethylene terephthalate, granulate, bottle grade {RER}| polyethylene terephthalate production, granulate, bottle grade | Cut-off, S

The dataset represents the production mix of commercial bottle grade PET production technologies. PET production covered by this study is by esterification of ethylene glycol and terephthalic acid (PTA). The esterification process is carried out under moderate pressure (2.5-5.5 bar) and at high temperature (230-270 °C) whilst the water formed during the reaction is continuously removed via distillation. 

The monomers of PET production, purified terephthalic acid (PTA) and mono ethylene glycol (MEG) are polymerised in the liquid phase to produce amorphous PET. This form of the polymer is suitable for the production of fibres and film. Most bottle grade PET today is a copolyester slightly modified through addition of 1-2% Benzene-1,3-dicarboxylic acid (isophthalic acid, IPA) or 4(hydroxymethyl)cyclohexyl-methanol (cyclohexanedimethanol, CHDM) during polymerisation.

The first step of PET production is the esterification of PTA and MEG to bishydroxyethyl terepthalate (BHET) with water as a by-product at around 220-260 °C in the presence of an anti-mony catalyst (usually Sb2O3). Water forming from the esterification reaction is continuously removed by distillation. Formation of the undesired side product diethylene glycol is suppressed by maintaining low molar ratios of MEG:PTA (less than 2 or even 1.5). BHET is then sent to Pre-polycondensation in a second reactor under a vacuum and further to a melt polycondensation reactor at higher temperatures and still under vacuum. Vacuum is required to remove water and other side products and to drive the reaction equilibrium towards the polymer.

As melt polymerisation does not produce high molecular weight, a subsequent polymerisation step, solid state polymerisation (SSP) is required for bottle grade PET. During SSP the polymer chain lengths are increased by heat in the absence of oxygen and water, by means of either vacuum or purging with an inert gas to drive off the by-products of reactions. The reaction is driven by temperature, pressure, and the diffusion of by-products from the interior of the pellet to the surface. The product of SSP is a partially crystalline resin that can be used to produce bottles via injection moulding and stretch blow moulding.

Production volume: 3400000000 kg
Included activities start: Acitivity starts with PTA entering the polymerisation plant. Both amorphous and bottle grade PET produciton are included. Energy supply is included in terms of heat production inside the battery limits of the plant. Steam and electricity supply is outside the activity.
Included activities end: Activity ends with polymer granulate leaving the factory.
Energy values: Undefined
Geography: The inventory is modelled for Europe
Technology level: Current
Technology: Coverage of production capacity in Europe: 85%
Start date: 01/01/2015
End date: 31/12/2022
Is data valid for entire period: True
Time period: Data was collected for the year 2015, processed in 2016 and published in 2017
Macro-economic scenario name: Business-as-Usual

activityName: Mint {RoW}| mint production | Cut-off, U - Adapted from Ecoinvent U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.
original ecoinvent name: Mint {RoW}| mint production | Cut-off, U

This dataset is a weighted average of the regional datasets, with weights based on production volume of the reference product.  Detailed comments and sources about the exchanges can be found in the regional datasets.

The geographicalCorrelation score of every pedigree matrix of was changed to '5'.

Sum of regional production volumes: 8.000e+9 kg

IN: PV = 6.000e+9 kg; weight = 0.75

US: PV = 2.000e+9 kg; weight = 0.25

Yield of the global dataset = 28125 kg/ha, calculated as a weighted average of the regional Yield_s.

The comments below were part of the IN regional dataset.

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg mint. The average Yield_ from 1999 is 16.5 t/ha. The data are representative for mint production in India, Uttar Pradesh, used for the export market. Mineral NPK fertiliser input is 160-50-50 kg/ha. No organic fertilisers are applied. Total active ingredients (a.i.) applied as pesticides amount to 0.74 kg a.i./ha.

The dataset was modelled within the project 'World Food LCA database (WFLDB)'. The aim of this project was to provide inventories of a broad variety of agricultural products and processes and to cover for each product at least 50% of the global export market. The production system regarded in this dataset aimed at representing mint produced in India for the export market.

PEF-Quality: data quality rating (DQR) = 2.7 (i.e. good quality). This dataset refers to an average situation; for specific situations exchanges might differ substantially due to site specific parameters

Production volume: 8000000000 kg
Included activities start: This activity starts with the nursery producing seedlings, i.e. seedlings from roots.
Included activities end: This activity ends with the clearing of the field (removing of mint plants). The dataset includes all activities of a year in the productive phase of the field including the establishment phase per year of lifetime (4 years), and the clearing of the field. 
The establishment phase of the field includes seedlings nursery, soil cultivation, planting, herbicide use and irrigation.
The productive phase of the field includes machine operations, fuel use and sheds. Machine operations in the productive phase are: soil cultivation, fertiliser and pesticide application, harvesting, transport on farm and irrigation. Further, direct field emissions and land use change are included. At the end of the productive phase the field is cleared by removing the mint plants.
Heavy metal uptake by the crop is considered. The inputs of seedlings, fertilisers and pesticides as well as packaging of fertilisers and pesticides are considered. The dataset doesn't include drying.

Geography: The inventory is modelled for Rest-of-World
Technology level: Current

This inventory cannot be used to represent the same type of packaging for other products outside the sub-category "Knack sausages" (PACK_AGB).

The data was produced from study of packaging on the French market (supermarket reference), weighing of two references and CTCPA packaging expertise.
Two references were weighed to best represent the French market. They are marketed both under own brand and under private label.
The weight of 210g of product used was obtained by averaging two references of 210g each. The weight of the packaging corresponds to the average of the weighed packaging.

The inventory includes : (1) production of packaging materials***, (2) manufacture and finishing of packaging components, (3) intermediate transport from the production of materials to the packaging site, and (4) the end-of-life management of packaging*** as it takes place in France. ***Application of CCF, rate of virgin and recycled materials corresponding to the FR scenario (2022) 
The inventory does not include distribution transport (integrated into the next stage at distribution in AGRIBALYSE).

activityName: Seafood, 290g | Packaging System, Proxy Pack, Rigid plastic, other than bottles {FR} U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.

The inventory includes : (1) only the main packaging material (in contact with the product) ; (2) the transport for packaging supply (ratio FR and ratio RER) ; (3) only the main process ; (4) the end of life of the main packaging material.

Functional unit: 1kg of packaged food product

The packaging solutions mentioned as PROXY PACK have been developed with a simplified approach but are based on datasets from PACK-AGB project. These datasets have not been developed for use in comparative LCAs of packaging solutions: if this is your purpose, we recommend that you follow the ADEME reference framework on comparative comparative LCA between different packaging solutions: https://librairie.ademe.fr/dechets-economie-circulaire/5309-cadre-de-reference-acv-comparatives-entre-differentes-solutions-d-emballages.html

Overall data quality : DQR= 1,25; Technological representativeness (TeR) = 1; Geographical representativeness (GR) = 2; Time-related representativeness (TiR) = 1; Precision (P material) = 1; Precision (P processing) = 1

Time period: Inventory data based on 2023 " Plein Pot Sur les Emballages " (PPSE) data (data from ADEME and Open Food Facts)

Use of "PPSE" data to improve packaging modelling for products not covered by the "PACK AGB" project. Data verified by CTCPA's packaging expert.

General assumptions

For "PPSE" missing data, assumptions are based on CTCPA expertise 
Some multi-layer packaging (identified by CTCPA's expert) are modeled using a packaging solution from PACK AGB project. Nota bene the packaging format may be different.

Assumptions at each stage: 

Production
- Only the packaging material in contact with the product or ensuring the product's shelf life is modeled.
For example, in the case of cookies packaged in PP plastic bags (element 1), themselves packaged in a cardboard box (elements 2): (i) Element 2 is the heaviest / (ii) Element 1 is in contact with the product, so the PP material was taken into account.
- For multi-element and multi-layer packaging, the inventory calls for the material in contact with the product and for the quantity, an assumption has been made to take of the packaging solution (sum of all elements) and consider this value for this material.
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative material.

Processing
- Only the most representative process for the most representative packaging material is included.
For example, in the case of a multi-layer flexible film, only the extrusion process is modeled. The lamination process used to combine the various packaging layers was not included. 
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used for the most representative process.

Transport
- The assumptions of the PACK AGB project were applied
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material
- Ratios from France and Europe compiled in the PACK AGB project by packaging material were used (ADEME data, 2020).

End of life
- All plastic packaging is considered non-recycled (R2=0%).
To be able to affirm that the plastic packaging is recycled, it is necessary to consider the whole packaging solution (with all the elements and materials) and in this project the dataset only include a part of the packaging (proxy)
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material. 
- The Circular FootPrint Formula was applied.

Générateurs : CTCPA
Vérificateurs : CTCPA (packaging expert from CTCPA)
Contact : Pauline AUDOYE (paudoye@ctcpa.org) ; Mathilde BRAMBATI (mbrambati@ctcpa.org) ; Margaux COLOMBIN(mcolombin@ctcpa.org)
Property rights : OpenData, licence "Ecolab".  
Propriété : ADEME

activityName: Rapeseed, at farm {GLO} - Adapted from WFLDB U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024. 
This dataset has been adapted for Agribalyse 3.2.
- Background Ecoinvent data have been updated to Ecoinvent 3.9.1
_________________________________
This dataset represents the global average for Rapeseed, at farm. It is calculated as weighted average of the following countries, based on their respective export shares according to FAOSTAT data for 2010:
 - Canada 44%
 - France 9%
 - United States 2%
 - Germany 2%
These countries together represent 57% of global export. 
All farming activities documented in the respective national datasets are included. No transportation to the marketplace is considered.
The functional unit is the production of 1 kg of Rapeseed, at standard water content required for storage of 8%.

Data quality rating (DQR) = 1.3 (i.e. excellent quality)

comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.
This dataset has been adapted for Agribalyse with recommendations from ACTALIA (september 2022).
- milk is French average
- Yield_ is specific for the type of butter
- parameters add to calculate the amount of coproducts and allocation after Yield_ modification
- cream is deleted
- electricity is French
- Background Ecoinvent data have been updated to Ecoinvent 3.9.1
- Water and waste water is French
_________________________________
Included processes: This multi-output process covers the production of butter, skimmed milk and buttermilk. The butter is unsalted. The inventory includes the inputs of raw milk, energy, water and cleaning agents. Transport of raw milk to the dairy facility is included. Chilled storage of the product at initial warehouse is included. Wastewater treatment and infrastructure are included. Yeast input is included with an empty (""dummy"") dataset. Packaging is not included.
Remark: The functional unit is the production of 1 kg of dairy product. The production system is typical of industrial dairies in Europe. Allocation between co-products is based on their dry matter (DM) content with the following allocation factors: 
 - butter: 33%
 - skimmed milk: 63%
 - buttermilk: 4%
Data quality rating (DQR) = 2.2 ( i.e. good quality)

activityName: Carrot, organic, Lower Normandy, at farm gate {FR} U
comment:

Included processes: The inventory includes : (1) the processes of soil preparation and cultivation, sowing, weed control, fertilisation, pest and pathogen control, harvest; (2) the machines and shed or surface used to park them; (3) all inputs as seed, fertilizers (mineral and organic), active substances, water for irrigation, fuels as well as the transport to the farm; (4) the direct emissions of the fuel combustion, the abrasion of tyres and the direct emissions on the field.
The temporal border of the inventory is 'harvest to harvest'.
Cut-off rule, exclusion : The inventory does not include processes occuring after harvest as 'drying', 'sorting' or 'storing', even if they happen on farm.

activityName: Cashew, in-shell, at farm (WFLDB)
comment:
Reference flow: The functional unit is the production of 1 kg of cashew, in-shell, at farm (moisture content 7-8%). The reference flow is the average yield per ha and year (422 kg/ha) obtained under non-irrigated conditions (according to Carr 2013, less than 1% of the cashew plantation are irrigated in the world, no irrigation is therefore considered in this dataset).

Allocation: No allocation

System boundaries: Cradle-to-gate. The inventory includes inputs of organic fertilisers and seedlings. According to ACi, most farmers do not engage in pest control and fertiliser application during the plantation of cashew trees. Planting, harvesting and other field activities are manually handled, and a first drying under the sun is considered. Direct field emissions from manure application and land use change are included. Direct emissions from crop residues management are also considered, assuming 50% of the residues are spread on field and 50% are composted in non-aerated heaps. Number of years from planting to clearing (lifetime): 30 years. Average tree density is 290 trees/ha. 

Data quality rating: 2.3 (i.e. good quality)

Geography: Côte d'Ivoire

Technology: Conventional production

Time: 1999-2017

Data sources:
- Mohod (2010) Energy Option for Small Scale Cashew Nut Processing in India. Energy Res J 1:4750. doi: 10.3844/erjsp.2010.47.50

activityName: Barley grain, non-irrigated, at farm (WFLDB)
comment:

The reference flow is the average yield per ha and year, from 2017 (2.20 t/ha) produced under non-irrigated conditions, with 1517 kg of barley straw produced as co-product.

Allocation: Based on economic allocation: barley grain (75.6%) and barley straw (24.4%).
 
System boundaries: Cradle-to-gate. The inventory includes inputs of fertilisers, pesticides, and seeds, as well as field work processes and the associated diesel combusted in agricultural machinery. Equipment infrastructure is also considered. Direct field emissions from crop production activities (e.g. fertiliser and pesticide use) and land use change are included.
 
Data quality rating (DQR) = 1.7, Very good quality

activityName: Burger, 750g | Packaging System, Proxy Pack, Plastic film {FR} U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.

The inventory includes : (1) only the main packaging material (in contact with the product) ; (2) the transport for packaging supply (ratio FR and ratio RER) ; (3) only the main process ; (4) the end of life of the main packaging material.

Functional unit: 1kg of packaged food product

The packaging solutions mentioned as PROXY PACK have been developed with a simplified approach but are based on datasets from PACK-AGB project. These datasets have not been developed for use in comparative LCAs of packaging solutions: if this is your purpose, we recommend that you follow the ADEME reference framework on comparative comparative LCA between different packaging solutions: https://librairie.ademe.fr/dechets-economie-circulaire/5309-cadre-de-reference-acv-comparatives-entre-differentes-solutions-d-emballages.html

Overall data quality : DQR= 2; Technological representativeness (TeR) = 4; Geographical representativeness (GR) = 2; Time-related representativeness (TiR) = 1; Precision (P material) = 1; Precision (P processing) = 1

Time period: Inventory data based on 2023 " Plein Pot Sur les Emballages " (PPSE) data (data from ADEME and Open Food Facts)

Use of "PPSE" data to improve packaging modelling for products not covered by the "PACK AGB" project. Data verified by CTCPA's packaging expert.

General assumptions

For "PPSE" missing data, assumptions are based on CTCPA expertise 
Some multi-layer packaging (identified by CTCPA's expert) are modeled using a packaging solution from PACK AGB project. Nota bene the packaging format may be different.

Assumptions at each stage: 

Production
- Only the packaging material in contact with the product or ensuring the product's shelf life is modeled.
For example, in the case of cookies packaged in PP plastic bags (element 1), themselves packaged in a cardboard box (elements 2): (i) Element 2 is the heaviest / (ii) Element 1 is in contact with the product, so the PP material was taken into account.
- For multi-element and multi-layer packaging, the inventory calls for the material in contact with the product and for the quantity, an assumption has been made to take of the packaging solution (sum of all elements) and consider this value for this material.
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative material.

Processing
- Only the most representative process for the most representative packaging material is included.
For example, in the case of a multi-layer flexible film, only the extrusion process is modeled. The lamination process used to combine the various packaging layers was not included. 
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used for the most representative process.

Transport
- The assumptions of the PACK AGB project were applied
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material
- Ratios from France and Europe compiled in the PACK AGB project by packaging material were used (ADEME data, 2020).

End of life
- All plastic packaging is considered non-recycled (R2=0%).
To be able to affirm that the plastic packaging is recycled, it is necessary to consider the whole packaging solution (with all the elements and materials) and in this project the dataset only include a part of the packaging (proxy)
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material. 
- The Circular FootPrint Formula was applied.

Générateurs : CTCPA
Vérificateurs : CTCPA (packaging expert from CTCPA)
Contact : Pauline AUDOYE (paudoye@ctcpa.org) ; Mathilde BRAMBATI (mbrambati@ctcpa.org) ; Margaux COLOMBIN(mcolombin@ctcpa.org)
Property rights : OpenData, licence "Ecolab".  
Propriété : ADEME

Direct emissions: NH3 (EMEP 2009 tier 2 for organic fertilisation + 2013 tier 2 for mineral fertilisation), NO (EMEP 2009), N2O (IPCC 2006 tier1), NO3- (Tailleurs et al.), erosion (RUSLE adapted for Agribalyse), P (SALCA-P adapted for Agribalyse), ETM (SALCA-ETM adapted for Agribalyse), Occupation and transformation of the soil (Ecoinvent v2 2007), pesticides (Ecoinvent v2 2007), biogenic CO2 and CO2 from Urea (IPCC 2006). The methodology of calculation is available in Ecoalim methodological guide.
Allocation between crops: N and P from organic fertilizers, P and K mineral, nitrate.
Technology: efficient farming practices.
Time period: 2008-2012.

Egg, conventionnal, national average, at farm gate {FR} U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.
Translated name: uf, Moyenne nationale (France), sortie atelier
Included processes: The inventory includes : all activites of a poultry farm, that is (1) all inputs as livestock (young animal), feeds, water (watering and cleaning), fuels and energy used for the hatchery as well as the transport to the farm; (2) the buildings and barns (3) emissions due to the effluent management
The temporal border of the inventory is 'one year of production'.
Cut-off rule/Exclusion: The inventory does not include vet products and cares, artificial insemination process, small cleaning material and all processes occuring outside of the farm (slaughtering, processing, conservation etc).
Remark: AGRIBALYSE - product declaration.
Refers to 1 kg of egg, national average.
ILCD - Overall data quality:
Technological representativeness (TeR) = 2 (good): >=85% and < 95%
Geographical representativeness (GR) = 2 (good): >=85% and < 95%
Time-related representativeness (TiR) = 1 (very good): >=95%
Completeness (C) = 2 (good): >=85% and < 95%
Precision / uncertainty (P) = 2 (good): >7% and <=10%
Methodological appropriateness and consistency (M) = 2 (good): >=85% and < 95%
Final note = 1,9 (i.e.: basic quality).
Weight of an egg: 60 g. Number of eggs per hen: 293 per year. Breeding time: 372 days.
Coproducts: Egg and cull hen
Allocation: see base inventories
Background data: All background data orginates either from ecoinvent 3.4, INRA or from AGRIBALYSE.
Dataset was generated by MEANS-InOut software. Models used : [N2O - IPCC 2006, tier 2; NO - EMEP/EEA, 2016 - Tier 1; N - ITAVI 2013; CH4 - IPCC 2006b; NO3 - Basset-Mens 2007; NH3 - EMEP 2009, tier 2; ]
Geography: France
Technology: Average mix of technology for the production of eggs in France.
Time period: Inventory data based on the period 2005-2009.
Energy values: Net values
Percent representativeness: 100
Production volume: 100% of the national production

activityName: European pilchard or sardine, consumption mix {FR} U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024. See the complete description of AGRIBALYSE database.
 This process describes the average consumption mix of European pilchard or sardine in France.
Included activities are : production in country of origin and transport 
For all fish data are based on expert say.
The share of domestic production is 40%, while the remainder is split equitably between EU import (refrigerated truck transport per 1,000 km) and non-EU import (refrigerated boat transport per 10,000 km)
The mapping with fishing datasets is based on the predominant fishing mode of each species. This work was developed with the help of technical institute (Comité des pêches, Thomas Clotre, April 2019)

activityName: Lemon {ES}| lemon production | Cut-off, U - Adapted from Ecoinvent U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.
original ecoinvent name: Lemon {ES}| lemon production | Cut-off, U

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of lemons. The average Yield_ from 2009 - 2012 is 37 t/ha. The data are representative for lemons production in Spain used for the export market. §

The dataset was modelled within the project 'World Food LCA database (WFLDB)'. The aim of this project was to provide inventories of a broad variety of agricultural products and processes and to cover for each product at least 50% of the global export market. The export share of lemons produced in Spain amounts to 16% of the global export (tonnage exported in 2010). The production system regarded in this dataset aimed at representing lemons produced in Spain for the export market.

PEF-Quality: data quality rating (DQR) = 2.3 (i.e. good quality). This dataset refers to an average situation; for specific situations exchanges might differ substantially due to site specific parameters

Production volume: 674371008 kg
Included activities start: This activity starts with the nursery producing fruit tree seedlings, i.e. grafted young trees to be planted.
Included activities end: This activity ends with the waste treatment after the clearing of the orchard (rooting up the trees). The dataset includes all activities of a year in a year in the productive phase of the orchard including the establishment phase per year of lifetime (30 years, 256 trees/ha planted), the clearing of the orchard including waste treatment. 
The establishment phase of the orchard includes tree nursery, soil cultivation, planting trees, sowing grass, and irrigation. Fertiliser and pesticide use in a year of the establishment phase is assumed to be half of the amount of a year in the productive phase.
The productive phase of the orchard includes machine operations, corresponding infrastructure, fuel use and sheds. Machine operations in the productive phase are: soil cultivation (mulching, mowing), fertiliser and pesticide application, harvesting and irrigation. Further, direct field emissions and land use change are included. At the end of the productive phase the orchard is cleared by rooting up the trees.
Heavy metal uptake by the crop is considered.
The inputs of seedlings, fertilisers (mineral and organic) and pesticides as well as packaging of fertilisers and pesticides are considered.
Energy values: Undefined
Geography: The inventory is modelled for Spain
Technology level: Current
Technology: Conventional production
Start date: 01/01/2009
End date: 31/12/2022
Is data valid for entire period: True
Time period: 
Macro-economic scenario name: Business-as-Usual

activityName: Soybean, not associated to deforestation {BR}| market for soybean, without transport | Cut-off, U - Adapted from Ecoinvent
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.
To use this inventory, any soy must not have been produced on land that was deforested the last 20 years i.e. on the time period 2004-2024.
The 20 years threshold is based on the amount of time needed for stored carbon to reach equilibrium (often 20 years in the IPCC default methods).


Adaptation made for Agribalyse :
Mix is adapted to represent brasilians regions not associated with deforestation : these 3 regions do not contain any transformation flows linked to the transformation from Primary forest to arable land. 
Production shares are derived from provenances of soybean produced in Brazil and imported provided by ecoinvent data "Soybean {BR}| market for BR, without transport | Cut-off, U - Adapted from Ecoinvent" . To build this deforestation-free mix for France, the brazilian states with primary forest to arable land transformation flows were discarded and the production shares of the 3 states retained for this deforestation-free mix were normalized to 100%.
____________________________


This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.

This is the market for  'soybean', in the geography of Brazil.

This is dataset represents the transport of 1 kg of soybeans from the production farm to the plant producting soybean meal and soybean oil. No losses are considered in this dataset.

The product 'soybean' is a seed. It is an annual crop. The ecoinvent database also contains this product from organic and Swiss integrated production.

Production volume: 115711918080 kg
Included activities start: The activity starts at the gate of soybean cultivation farm.
Included activities end: The activity ends with the provision of soybean grains to the soybean meal and oil production plant.
Energy values: Undefined
Geography: The inventory is modelled for Brazil
Technology level: Current
Technology: The data are intended to reflect current equipment and processes on a Brazilian level.
Start date: 01/01/2011
End date: 31/12/2022
Is data valid for entire period: True
Time period: 
Macro-economic scenario name: Business-as-Usual

activityName: Egg, organic, at farm gate {FR} U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024. 
Included processes: The inventory includes : The inventory includes : all activites of a poultry farm, that is (1) all inputs as livestock (young animal), feeds, water (watering and cleaning), fuels and energy used for the hatchery as well as the transport to the farm; (2) the buildings and barns (3) emissions due to the effluent management
The temporal border of the inventory is 'one year of production'.
Cut-off rule, exclusion : The inventory does not include vet products and cares, artificial insemination process, small cleaning material and all processes occuring outside of the farm (slaughtering, processing, conservation etc).
Refers to 1 kg of egg or 1 kg (live weight) of cull hen.
Allocation: Allocation to the coproducts egg and cull hen has been performed using the biophysical allocation approach. Eggs : 100% of the laying hens stage. Cull hens : 100% of the future reproductives, reproductives and youg hens stages.
Remark: Functional unit:1 kg of egg, organic production or 1 kg (live weight) of cull hen, organic production.
Coproducts: 70035.18 kg  Egg, 4385.0 Cull hen (weight 1,91 kg)
Raw datas comes from:Sampling procedure: The data is based on literature and statistical data as well as expert judgements. Transformation have been performed (weightening and assignments of the flows as well as calculation of direct field emissions).
PEF  Overall data quality : 
Technological representativeness (TeR) = 3 : Fair
Geographical representativeness (GR) = 2 : Good
Time-related representativeness (TiR) = 2 : Good
Precision / uncertainty (P) = 3 : Fair
Final note = 2,5 : Good data quality level
undefined

activityName: Sheep milk, conventional, Roquefort system, at farm gate {FR} U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024. 
Included processes: The inventory includes : The inventory includes : all activites of a sheep farm, that is (1) all inputs as livestock (young animal), feeds, straw, water (watering and cleaning), fuels and energy as well as the transport to the farm; (2) the buildings and housings as well as infrastructure for milking; (3) the enteric emissions as well as emissions due to the effluent management
The temporal border of the inventory is 1 year of production
This LCI include a water footprint calculation, according to the AGRIBALYSE 2 water scarcity assessment project. For more information about the method, see ADEME. MARTIN Edith (Quantis). 2018. Agribalyse ® 2  empreinte eau : rapport méthodologique. 
WARNING : only the direct water footprint of the animals is calculated here. The feedstuff doesn't contain a full water footprint evaluation. The user should be very careful about the interpretation of the results as the water footprint is not calculated on the full life cycle.
Cut-off rule, exclusion : The inventory does not include vet products and cares, artificial insemination process, small cleaning material and all processes occuring outside of the farm (slaughtering, processing, conservation etc).
Refers to 1 kg of FPC sheep milk or 1kg of wool or 1 kg (live weight) of cull ewe or 1 kg (live weight) of lamb
Allocation to the coproducts milk, cull ewe, lamb and wool has been performed using the biophysical allocation approach.
  Lamb : 100% of weaned lamb + 9.28% of diary ewe
  Wool : 1.36% of 1 year old ewe + 2.01% of diary ewe
  Cull ewe : 98.64% of 1 year old ewe
  Milk : 88.71 of diary ewe

Coproducts: 432.0 Sold lamb (weight 14 kg), undefined kg  Wool, 157681.0 kg  Milk, undefined kg  Wool, 86.0 Cast dairy ewe (weight 75 kg)
Raw datas comes from:The data is based on literature and statistical data as well as expert judgements. Transformation have been performed (weightening and assignments of the flows as well as calculation of direct field emissions).

activityName: Sandwich, 190g | Packaging System, Proxy Pack, Plastic film {FR} U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.

The inventory includes : (1) only the main packaging material (in contact with the product) ; (2) the transport for packaging supply (ratio FR and ratio RER) ; (3) only the main process ; (4) the end of life of the main packaging material.

Functional unit: 1kg of packaged food product

The packaging solutions mentioned as PROXY PACK have been developed with a simplified approach but are based on datasets from PACK-AGB project. These datasets have not been developed for use in comparative LCAs of packaging solutions: if this is your purpose, we recommend that you follow the ADEME reference framework on comparative comparative LCA between different packaging solutions: https://librairie.ademe.fr/dechets-economie-circulaire/5309-cadre-de-reference-acv-comparatives-entre-differentes-solutions-d-emballages.html

Overall data quality : DQR= 2,25; Technological representativeness (TeR) = 1; Geographical representativeness (GR) = 2; Time-related representativeness (TiR) = 5; Precision (P material) = 1; Precision (P processing) = 1

Time period: Inventory data based on 2023 " Plein Pot Sur les Emballages " (PPSE) data (data from ADEME and Open Food Facts)

Use of "PPSE" data to improve packaging modelling for products not covered by the "PACK AGB" project. Data verified by CTCPA's packaging expert.

General assumptions

For "PPSE" missing data, assumptions are based on CTCPA expertise 
Some multi-layer packaging (identified by CTCPA's expert) are modeled using a packaging solution from PACK AGB project. Nota bene the packaging format may be different.

Assumptions at each stage: 

Production
- Only the packaging material in contact with the product or ensuring the product's shelf life is modeled.
For example, in the case of cookies packaged in PP plastic bags (element 1), themselves packaged in a cardboard box (elements 2): (i) Element 2 is the heaviest / (ii) Element 1 is in contact with the product, so the PP material was taken into account.
- For multi-element and multi-layer packaging, the inventory calls for the material in contact with the product and for the quantity, an assumption has been made to take of the packaging solution (sum of all elements) and consider this value for this material.
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative material.

Processing
- Only the most representative process for the most representative packaging material is included.
For example, in the case of a multi-layer flexible film, only the extrusion process is modeled. The lamination process used to combine the various packaging layers was not included. 
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used for the most representative process.

Transport
- The assumptions of the PACK AGB project were applied
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material
- Ratios from France and Europe compiled in the PACK AGB project by packaging material were used (ADEME data, 2020).

End of life
- All plastic packaging is considered non-recycled (R2=0%).
To be able to affirm that the plastic packaging is recycled, it is necessary to consider the whole packaging solution (with all the elements and materials) and in this project the dataset only include a part of the packaging (proxy)
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material. 
- The Circular FootPrint Formula was applied.

Générateurs : CTCPA
Vérificateurs : CTCPA (packaging expert from CTCPA)
Contact : Pauline AUDOYE (paudoye@ctcpa.org) ; Mathilde BRAMBATI (mbrambati@ctcpa.org) ; Margaux COLOMBIN(mcolombin@ctcpa.org)
Property rights : OpenData, licence "Ecolab".  
Propriété : ADEME

activityName: Oat grain {RoW}| oat production | Cut-off, U - Adapted from Ecoinvent U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.
original ecoinvent name: Oat grain {RoW}| oat production | Cut-off, U

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of oat grain (wet mass). 

This dataset has been extrapolated from an original dataset covering the geography Québec (Canada).

This activity was adapted to include the global average land use change (LUC) emissions according 2nd edition of the Quantis-modified tool developed by Blonk Consultants 'WFLDB-adapted-Blonk 2014 direct-land-use-change-assessment-tool_2015-05-18a.xlsx', tab. 'Country & land use unknown'. The size of the emission depends on (i) the relative crop expansion in all countries of the crop during the last 20 years and (ii) the corresponding, country specific land transformations. The current results are based on the average FAOSTAT data (harvested area) of 2009-2011 and 1989-1991. The weighted average is used which takes into account relative difference in crop expansion into primary forest, secondary forest, grassland, perennial and annual land.

Production volume: 17055866880 kg
Included activities start: This activity starts with soil cultivation after the harvest of the previous crop.
Included activities end: This activity ends after harvest and drying of grains at the farm gate.
The dataset includes the inputs of seeds, mineral and organic fertilisers, pesticides and all machine operations and corresponding machine infrastructure and sheds. Machine operations are: soil cultivation, transport of seeds, fertilisers and pesticides to the field (15 km), sowing, fertilisation, weed control, pest and pathogen control, combine-harvesting, transport from field to farm or local drying centre and drying of grains. Direct field emissions are also included. The use of car, van or pick-up for servicing people, e.g. from farm to field, is not included in the activities. Note that there is likely irrigation involved at the GLO scale, but no data were specifically collected for the dataset since it is extrapolated from the QC-CA geography where no irrigation is applied.

activityName: Mandarin {ES}| mandarin production | Cut-off, U - Adapted from Ecoinvent U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.
original ecoinvent name: Mandarin {ES}| mandarin production | Cut-off, U

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of mandarins. The average Yield_ from 2009 - 2012 is 30 t/ha. The data are representative for mandarin production in Spain used for the export market. Mineral NPK fertiliser input is 200-80-270 kg/ha. No organic fertilisers are applied. Total active ingredients (a.i.) applied as pesticides amount to 13.86 kg a.i./ha.

The dataset was modelled within the project 'World Food LCA database (WFLDB)'. The aim of this project was to provide inventories of a broad variety of agricultural products and processes and to cover for each product at least 50% of the global export market. The export share of mandarins produced in Spain amounts to 33% of the global export (tonnage exported in 2010). The production system regarded in this dataset aimed at representing mandarins produced in Spain for the export market.

PEF-Quality: data quality rating (DQR) = 3.0 (i.e. good quality). This dataset refers to an average situation; for specific situations exchanges might differ substantially due to site specific parameters

Production volume: 2046639488 kg
Included activities start: This activity starts with the nursery producing tree seedlings, i.e. grafted young trees to be planted.
Included activities end: This activity ends with the waste treatment after the clearing of the orchard (rooting up the trees). The dataset includes all activities of a year in a year in the productive phase of the orchard including the establishment phase per year of lifetime (30 years, 256 trees/ha planted), the clearing of the orchard including waste treatment. 
The establishment phase of the orchard includes tree nursery, soil cultivation, planting trees, sowing grass, and irrigation. Fertiliser and pesticide use in a year of the establishment phase is assumed to be half of the amount of a year in the productive phase.
The productive phase of the orchard includes machine operations, corresponding infrastructure, fuel use and sheds. Machine operations in the productive phase are: soil cultivation (mulching, mowing), fertiliser and pesticide application, harvesting and irrigation. Further, direct field emissions and land use change are included. At the end of the productive phase the orchard is cleared by rooting up the trees.
The inputs of seedlings, fertilisers (mineral and organic) and pesticides as well as packaging of fertilisers and pesticides are considered. The dataset doesn't include emissions from manure storage because these are within the system boundary of animal production.  Heavy metal uptake by the crop is considered.
Energy values: Undefined
Geography: The inventory is modelled for Spain
Technology level: Current
Technology: Conventional production

activityName: Tap water {ZA}| market for tap water | Cut-off, S - Copied from Ecoinvent U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.
original ecoinvent name: Tap water {ZA}| market for tap water | Cut-off, S

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.

This is the market for  'tap water', in the geography of South Africa.

Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.

Production volume: 4149318516736 kg
Included activities start: This activity starts from tap water, under pressure, at tap water treatment plant and fed into the tap water distribution network.
Included activities end: This activity ends with 1 kg of water at consumer (industrial or household).

This dataset includes: 
 - the distribution network
 - water losses during transmission 

This dataset doesn't include
 - energy used during distribution for additional pressure. The tap water is already under pressure when fed into the network (see corresponding tap water production datasets). The implicit assumption is that no additional energy is required during distribution to overcome loss of load in the distribution network. This assumption is not always correct.
 - emissions to groundwater associated with water leaving the distribution network through leaks. These are assumed to be inconsequential since we are dealing with treated tap water.
Energy values: Undefined
Geography: The inventory is modelled for South Africa
Technology level: Current
Technology:

End date: 31/12/2022

- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material
- Ratios from France and Europe compiled in the PACK AGB project by packaging material were used (ADEME data, 2020).

End of life
- All plastic packaging is considered non-recycled (R2=0%).
To be able to affirm that the plastic packaging is recycled, it is necessary to consider the whole packaging solution (with all the elements and materials) and in this project the dataset only include a part of the packaging (proxy)
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material. 
- The Circular FootPrint Formula was applied.

Overall data quality : DQR= 2; Technological representativeness (TeR) = 4; Geographical representativeness (GR) = 2; Time-related representativeness (TiR) = 1; Precision (P material) = 1; Precision (P processing) = 1

Time period: Inventory data based on 2023 " Plein Pot Sur les Emballages " (PPSE) data (data from ADEME and Open Food Facts)

Use of "PPSE" data to improve packaging modelling for products not covered by the "PACK AGB" project. Data verified by CTCPA's packaging expert.

General assumptions

For "PPSE" missing data, assumptions are based on CTCPA expertise 
Some multi-layer packaging (identified by CTCPA's expert) are modeled using a packaging solution from PACK AGB project. Nota bene the packaging format may be different.

Assumptions at each stage: 

Production
- Only the packaging material in contact with the product or ensuring the product's shelf life is modeled.
For example, in the case of cookies packaged in PP plastic bags (element 1), themselves packaged in a cardboard box (elements 2): (i) Element 2 is the heaviest / (ii) Element 1 is in contact with the product, so the PP material was taken into account.
- For multi-element and multi-layer packaging, the inventory calls for the material in contact with the product and for the quantity, an assumption has been made to take of the packaging solution (sum of all elements) and consider this value for this material.
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative material.

Processing
- Only the most representative process for the most representative packaging material is included.
For example, in the case of a multi-layer flexible film, only the extrusion process is modeled. The lamination process used to combine the various packaging layers was not included. 
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used for the most representative process.

Transport
- The assumptions of the PACK AGB project were applied
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material
- Ratios from France and Europe compiled in the PACK AGB project by packaging material were used (ADEME data, 2020).

End of life
- All plastic packaging is considered non-recycled (R2=0%).
To be able to affirm that the plastic packaging is recycled, it is necessary to consider the whole packaging solution (with all the elements and materials) and in this project the dataset only include a part of the packaging (proxy)
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material. 
- The Circular FootPrint Formula was applied.

activityName: Peach, organic, national average, at orchard {FR} U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.
Translated name: Pêche, biologique  Moyenne nationale (France), sortie verger
Included processes: The inventory includes : (1) the inputs for and processes of soil preparation and cultivation, planting, weed control, fertilisation, pest and pathogen control, harvest; (2) the machines and shed or surface used to park them; (3) all inputs as seedlings, fertilizers (mineral and organic), active substances, water for irrigation, fuels as well as the transport to the farm; (4) the direct emissions of the fuel combustion, the abrasion of tyres and the direct emissions on the field.
The temporal border of the inventory corresponds to the life cyle of the orchard.
Cut-off rule/Exclusion: The inventory does not include processes occuring after harvest (storing) as well as all hand-works if any (e.g. pruning).
 - product declaration.
Refers to 1 kg of peach or nectarine, organic production.
ILCD - Overall data quality:
Technological representativeness (TeR) = 3 (fair): >=75% and < 85%
Geographical representativeness (GR) = 2 (good): >=85% and < 95%
Time-related representativeness (TiR) = 2 (good): >=85% and < 95%
Completeness (C) = 2 (good): >=85% and < 95%
Precision / uncertainty (P) = 3 (fair): >10% and <=15%
Methodological appropriateness and consistency (M) = 3 (fair): >=75% and < 85%
Final note = 2,7 (i.e.: basic quality).
Yield: 231000 kg/ha for 18 production years (i.e. average Yield_ of 12833 kg/ha/yr).
Coproducts: Tree shoot and stocks
Allocation: No allocation has been performed as the price of co-products is not known.

Dataset was generated by MEANS-InOut software. Models used : [Heavy metals Soil - SALCA-SM; CO2 Urea - IPCC 2006, tier 1; Heavy metals Leaching - SALCA-SM; Water  take off; Land occupation - ecoinvent v2; N2O Indirect - IPCC 2006, tier 1; Heavy metals Flow - SALCA-SM, Energy, in biomass - EcoInventv2, CO2 biogenic - EcoInvent2; Energy consumption; NH3 - EMEP 2016, tier 2; Phytosanitaries - EcoInvent2; Transport of inputs (ecoinvent v3); P erosion - SALCA-P; N2O Direct - IPCC 2006, tier 1; P Leaching - SALCA-P; NO3 - SQCB 2009; CO2 Liming - IPCC 2006, tier 1; Erosion - RUSLE simplified - SI units; P Flow - SALCA-P; NO - EMEP 2009, tier 1; ]
Geography: France
Technology: Organic production, average agricultural practices
Time period: Inventory data based on average data specified according to experts for the period 2005-2009.
Version: 1.40
Energy values: Net values
Percent representativeness: 1.5
Production volume: 1,5% of total peach production of France.

Overall data quality : DQR= 1,25; Technological representativeness (TeR) = 1; Geographical representativeness (GR) = 2; Time-related representativeness (TiR) = 1; Precision (P material) = 1; Precision (P processing) = 1

Time period: Inventory data based on 2023 " Plein Pot Sur les Emballages " (PPSE) data (data from ADEME and Open Food Facts)

Use of "PPSE" data to improve packaging modelling for products not covered by the "PACK AGB" project. Data verified by CTCPA's packaging expert.

General assumptions

For "PPSE" missing data, assumptions are based on CTCPA expertise 
Some multi-layer packaging (identified by CTCPA's expert) are modeled using a packaging solution from PACK AGB project. Nota bene the packaging format may be different.

Assumptions at each stage: 

Production
- Only the packaging material in contact with the product or ensuring the product's shelf life is modeled.
For example, in the case of cookies packaged in PP plastic bags (element 1), themselves packaged in a cardboard box (elements 2): (i) Element 2 is the heaviest / (ii) Element 1 is in contact with the product, so the PP material was taken into account.
- For multi-element and multi-layer packaging, the inventory calls for the material in contact with the product and for the quantity, an assumption has been made to take of the packaging solution (sum of all elements) and consider this value for this material.
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative material.

Processing
- Only the most representative process for the most representative packaging material is included.
For example, in the case of a multi-layer flexible film, only the extrusion process is modeled. The lamination process used to combine the various packaging layers was not included. 
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used for the most representative process.

Transport
- The assumptions of the PACK AGB project were applied
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material
- Ratios from France and Europe compiled in the PACK AGB project by packaging material were used (ADEME data, 2020).

End of life
- All plastic packaging is considered non-recycled (R2=0%).
To be able to affirm that the plastic packaging is recycled, it is necessary to consider the whole packaging solution (with all the elements and materials) and in this project the dataset only include a part of the packaging (proxy)
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material. 
- The Circular FootPrint Formula was applied.

activityName: European Pilchard, Sardina pilchardus, BBiscay, Seine, average, at landing {FR} U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.
Production-weighted average activity of 13 boats fishing for sardine in the Bay of Biscay (seine)

Translated name : Activité annuelle moyenne des navires ciblant la sardine à la bolinche dans le Golfe de Gascogne.
Fishery description : In France, sardine is fished in the Bay of Biscay by 15 to 20 meters long ships. They are mainly based in Saint-Guénolé, Concarneau and Douarnenez but a few units are present around Bayonne. They go out at night for 8 to 10 hours fishing trips and spend between 150 and 200 days at sea per year. Their fishing area is off the French Atlantic coasts. They use the seine technique and land other pelagic species such as mackerel, anchovy and horse-mackerel. Sardines are landed whole and fresh in the ships' french home ports.
Stock status : The Bay of Biscay sardine stock is considered overfished : F/Fmsy = 1,34 (ICES 2017 data ; overfished if F/Fmsy >1). 
Pressure on stocks indicator : 3,73E-07 (94,7% of catch taken into account). This indicator is based on scientific publications and was applied to the ICV Pêche project's fisheries. For more details, please see the methodological handbook available on ADEME website.
Included processes : 
	Inventory includes : use of resources and amount of emissions during fishing and storage operations as well as construction, maintenance and end-of-life of fishing boat and gears. 
	Inventory excludes : impacts caused by life on board and harbour activities including landing operations. 
Remark: AGRIBALYSE (based on the project AGRIBALYSE 2.0 LCI of French fisheries).
Refers to : Average annual activity of boats fishing for sardine in the Bay of Biscay (seine).
Geography : France.
Version : 1.0.

activityName: Ware potato, conventional, for fresh market, other varieties, at farm gate {FR} U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024. 
Included processes: The inventory includes : (1) the processes of soil cultivation, sowing, weed control, fertilisation, pest and pathogen control, harvest; (2) the machines and shed or surface used to park them; (3) all inputs as seed, fertilizers (mineral and organic), active substances, water for irrigation, fuels as well as the transport to the farm; (4) the direct emissions of the fuel combustion, the abrasion of tyres and the direct emissions on the field.
The temporal border of the inventory is 'harvest to harvest'. Fertilizers (K, P and organic N) have been adjusted in order to account for the whole rotation.
Cut-off rule, exclusion : The inventory does not include processes occuring after harvest as 'drying', 'sorting' or 'storing', even if they happen on farm.
Remark: Functional unit:1 kg of fresh matter of ware potato (other varieties than firm flesh),80% moisture,  conventional production. 
Raw datas comes from:The data is based on literature and statistical data as well as expert judgements. 
Transformation has been performed (weightening and assignments of the flows as well as calculation of direct field emissions).
PEF  Overall data quality :

Geographical representativeness (GR) = 2 : Good
Time-related representativeness (TiR) = 3 : Fair
Precision / uncertainty (P) = 2 : Good
Final note = 2,25 : Good data quality level

AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.

The inventory includes : (1) only the main packaging material (in contact with the product) ; (2) the transport for packaging supply (ratio FR and ratio RER) ; (3) only the main process ; (4) the end of life of the main packaging material.

Functional unit: 1kg of packaged food product

The packaging solutions mentioned as PROXY PACK have been developed with a simplified approach but are based on datasets from PACK-AGB project. These datasets have not been developed for use in comparative LCAs of packaging solutions: if this is your purpose, we recommend that you follow the ADEME reference framework on comparative comparative LCA between different packaging solutions: https://librairie.ademe.fr/dechets-economie-circulaire/5309-cadre-de-reference-acv-comparatives-entre-differentes-solutions-d-emballages.html

Overall data quality : DQR= 1,75; Technological representativeness (TeR) = 2; Geographical representativeness (GR) = 2; Time-related representativeness (TiR) = 2; Precision (P material) = 1; Precision (P processing) = 1

Time period: Inventory data based on 2023 " Plein Pot Sur les Emballages " (PPSE) data (data from ADEME and Open Food Facts)

Use of "PPSE" data to improve packaging modelling for products not covered by the "PACK AGB" project. Data verified by CTCPA's packaging expert.

General assumptions

For "PPSE" missing data, assumptions are based on CTCPA expertise 
Some multi-layer packaging (identified by CTCPA's expert) are modeled using a packaging solution from PACK AGB project. Nota bene the packaging format may be different.

Assumptions at each stage: 

Production
- Only the packaging material in contact with the product or ensuring the product's shelf life is modeled.
For example, in the case of cookies packaged in PP plastic bags (element 1), themselves packaged in a cardboard box (elements 2): (i) Element 2 is the heaviest / (ii) Element 1 is in contact with the product, so the PP material was taken into account.
- For multi-element and multi-layer packaging, the inventory calls for the material in contact with the product and for the quantity, an assumption has been made to take of the packaging solution (sum of all elements) and consider this value for this material.
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative material.

Processing
- Only the most representative process for the most representative packaging material is included.
For example, in the case of a multi-layer flexible film, only the extrusion process is modeled. The lamination process used to combine the various packaging layers was not included. 
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used for the most representative process.

Transport
- The assumptions of the PACK AGB project were applied
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material
- Ratios from France and Europe compiled in the PACK AGB project by packaging material were used (ADEME data, 2020).

End of life
- All plastic packaging is considered non-recycled (R2=0%).
To be able to affirm that the plastic packaging is recycled, it is necessary to consider the whole packaging solution (with all the elements and materials) and in this project the dataset only include a part of the packaging (proxy)
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material. 
- The Circular FootPrint Formula was applied.
