activityName: Wheat grain, at farm {GLO} - Adapted from WFLDB U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024. 
This dataset has been adapted for Agribalyse 3.2.
- Background Ecoinvent data have been updated to Ecoinvent 3.9.1
_________________________________
This dataset represents the global average for wheat grain, at farm. It is calculated as weighted average of the following countries, based on their respective export shares according to FAOSTAT data for 2016:
 - Russia: 14%
 - USA: 13%
 - Canada: 11%
 - France: 10%
 - Australia: 9%
These countries together represent 57% of global export. 
Non-irrigated wheat is assumed for all exporting countries. 

All farming activities documented in the respective national datasets are included. No transportation to the marketplace is considered.
The functional unit is the production of 1 kg of wheat grain with a water content of 15%.

Data quality rating (DQR) = 2.2 (i.e. good quality)

activityName: Spinach {GLO}| production | Cut-off, U - Adapted from Ecoinvent U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.
original ecoinvent name: Spinach {GLO}| spinach production | Cut-off, U

This dataset represents spinach production according to the Integrated Production standard in CH.

Yield: 25 t / ha.

Duration of one cropping cycle: 1.25 months.

Field production.

The LCA study, from which this LCI has been derived, contains detailed descriptions of the system boundaries and the data sources used (Stoessel et al. 2012). The publication is published and freely available with comprehensive supporting information:

http://pubs.acs.org/doi/pdf/10.1021/es2030577

Franziska Stoessel, Ronnie Juraske, Stephan Pfister, Stefanie Hellweg. (2012) Life Cycle Inventory and Carbon and Water FoodPrint of Fruits and Vegetables: Application to a Swiss Retailer. Environmental Science & Technology 6(46) 3253-3262.

None

This activity was adapted to include the global average land use change (LUC) emissions according 2nd edition of the Quantis-modified tool developed by Blonk Consultants 'WFLDB-adapted-Blonk 2014 direct-land-use-change-assessment-tool_2015-05-18a.xlsx', tab. 'Country & land use unknown'. The size of the emission depends on (i) the relative crop expansion in all countries of the crop during the last 20 years and (ii) the corresponding, country specific land transformations. The current results are based on the average FAOSTAT data (harvested area) of 2009-2011 and 1989-1991. The weighted average is used which takes into account relative difference in crop expansion into primary forest, secondary forest, grassland, perennial and annual land.

Production volume: 18088361984 kg
Included activities start: From sowing.
Included activities end: This activity ends with harvest and storage. 
The dataset includes a storage period of 0.15 month and it's use of electricity.  The pesticide inputs are classified according to their chemical classes and the emmssions are assigned to the soil (100%). 
Mercury emissions are neglected due to a lack of data while other heavy metal emissions are included. The dataset doesn't include infrastructure for production and storage facilities. No transports for agricultural means of production from the regional storage to the farm are included.
Energy values: Undefined
Geography: The inventory is modelled for Global
Technology level: Current
Technology: Integrated production
Start date: 01/01/2010
End date: 31/12/2022
Is data valid for entire period: True
Time period: 
Macro-economic scenario name: Business-as-Usual

activityName: Rapeseed oil, at oil mill {GLO} - Adapted from WFLDB U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024. 
This dataset has been adapted for Agribalyse 3.2.
- Background Ecoinvent data have been updated to Ecoinvent 3.9.1
_________________________________
"The ecoinvent process ""Rape oil, at oil mill/RER U"" is used as a proxy to model Rapseed oil extraction at oil mill.""Rape oil, at oil mill/RER U"" has an oil input of 1.9 kg rapeseed (allocated Yield_).
 Oil Yield_ (unallocated Yield_) was adapted for Rapseed, which amounts to 42.8% (i.e.2.15 kg Rapeseeds are needed for 1 kg Rapeseed oil). For Rapeseed at farm, the global dataset is used.
Economic allocation is applied, based on the price ratio between 1 kg oil and 1.2 kg of the co-product Rapseed oil cake. Price for 1 kg Rapseed oil = 918 US $/t

activityName: Hazelnut, in shell, at farm {IT} - Adapted from WFLDB U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024. 
This dataset has been adapted for Agribalyse 3.2.
- Background Ecoinvent data have been updated to Ecoinvent 3.9.1
_________________________________
Reference flow: The functional unit is the production of 1 kg of Hazelnuts in shell at the farm. The reference flow is the average Yield_ per hectare and year: 1.45574 t/ha, obtained under irrigated conditions (total  amount of water 1541.0 m3/ha). 

Allocation: No allocation

System boundaries: Cradle-to-gate. The inventory includes inputs of fertilisers, pesticides, and seeds, as well as field work processes and the associated diesel combusted in agricultural machinery. Equipment infrastructure is also considered, such as for sprinkler irrigation. Direct field emissions from crop production activities (e.g. fertiliser and pesticide use) and land use change are included.

Data quality rating(DQR) = 2.2 (i.e. good quality)

Geography: Italy

Technology: Conventional production

Time: 2002 - 2017

Data sources: 
- Yield: FAOstats average over the years 2013 - 2017
- Tree density, orchard lifetime and mineral fertilizers: Agrion, Fondazione per la ricerca l'innovazione e lo sviluppo tecnologico dell'agricoltura piemontese. Il nocciolo in Piemonte, Linee techniche 2016. Consulted in August 2019 on https://www.nocciolare.it/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/Linee-guida-2016-Agrion.pdf
- Irrigation: Bignami, C., Cristofori, V. Scossa, A., Bertazza, G. (2002). Effetto dell'irrigazione sulla composizione della nocciola. 2e Convegno Nazionale sul Nocciolo, pp.206 - 212.
- Machinery fuel (diesel) and pest management: average between data from Iran: Sabzevari, A., Kouchaki-Penchah, H. and Nabavi-Pelesaraei, A. (2015). Investigation of Life Cycle Assessment of Hazelnut Production in Guilan Province of I.R. Iran Based on Orchards size Levels. Biological Forum - An International Journal, pp.807 - 813., and from the Unites States: Julian, J.W., Seavert, C.F., Olsen, J.L., (2008). Orchard Economics: The costs and returns of establishing and producing hazelnuts in the Willamette Valley. Oregon State University, Extension Service. Consulted in August 2019 on http://arec.oregonstate.edu/oaeb/files/pdf/EM8748-E.pdf
- Husk residue management (biowaste): Gürdil GAK, Özcan Baz Y, Demirel B, Demirel C (2016) Pelleting hazelnut husk residues for biofuel. 6th International Conference on Trends in Agricultural Engineering.

activityName: Omelette or tortilla, 500g | Packaging System, Proxy Pack, Plastic film {FR} U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.

The inventory includes : (1) only the main packaging material (in contact with the product) ; (2) the transport for packaging supply (ratio FR and ratio RER) ; (3) only the main process ; (4) the end of life of the main packaging material.

Functional unit: 1kg of packaged food product

The packaging solutions mentioned as PROXY PACK have been developed with a simplified approach but are based on datasets from PACK-AGB project. These datasets have not been developed for use in comparative LCAs of packaging solutions: if this is your purpose, we recommend that you follow the ADEME reference framework on comparative comparative LCA between different packaging solutions: https://librairie.ademe.fr/dechets-economie-circulaire/5309-cadre-de-reference-acv-comparatives-entre-differentes-solutions-d-emballages.html

Overall data quality : DQR= 1,25; Technological representativeness (TeR) = 1; Geographical representativeness (GR) = 2; Time-related representativeness (TiR) = 1; Precision (P material) = 1; Precision (P processing) = 1

Time period: Inventory data based on 2023 " Plein Pot Sur les Emballages " (PPSE) data (data from ADEME and Open Food Facts)

Use of "PPSE" data to improve packaging modelling for products not covered by the "PACK AGB" project. Data verified by CTCPA's packaging expert.

General assumptions

For "PPSE" missing data, assumptions are based on CTCPA expertise 
Some multi-layer packaging (identified by CTCPA's expert) are modeled using a packaging solution from PACK AGB project. Nota bene the packaging format may be different.

Assumptions at each stage: 

Production
- Only the packaging material in contact with the product or ensuring the product's shelf life is modeled.
For example, in the case of cookies packaged in PP plastic bags (element 1), themselves packaged in a cardboard box (elements 2): (i) Element 2 is the heaviest / (ii) Element 1 is in contact with the product, so the PP material was taken into account.
- For multi-element and multi-layer packaging, the inventory calls for the material in contact with the product and for the quantity, an assumption has been made to take of the packaging solution (sum of all elements) and consider this value for this material.
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative material.

Processing
- Only the most representative process for the most representative packaging material is included.
For example, in the case of a multi-layer flexible film, only the extrusion process is modeled. The lamination process used to combine the various packaging layers was not included. 
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used for the most representative process.

Transport
- The assumptions of the PACK AGB project were applied
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material
- Ratios from France and Europe compiled in the PACK AGB project by packaging material were used (ADEME data, 2020).

End of life
- All plastic packaging is considered non-recycled (R2=0%).
To be able to affirm that the plastic packaging is recycled, it is necessary to consider the whole packaging solution (with all the elements and materials) and in this project the dataset only include a part of the packaging (proxy)
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material. 
- The Circular FootPrint Formula was applied.

Générateurs : CTCPA
Vérificateurs : CTCPA (packaging expert from CTCPA)
Contact : Pauline AUDOYE (paudoye@ctcpa.org) ; Mathilde BRAMBATI (mbrambati@ctcpa.org) ; Margaux COLOMBIN(mcolombin@ctcpa.org)
Property rights : OpenData, licence "Ecolab".  
Propriété : ADEME

These datasets have not been developed for use in comparative LCAs of packaging solutions: if this is your purpose, we recommend that you follow the ADEME reference framework on comparative comparative LCA between different packaging solutions: https://librairie.ademe.fr/dechets-economie-circulaire/5309-cadre-de-reference-acv-comparatives-entre-differentes-solutions-d-emballages.html

Overall data quality : DQR= 2; Technological representativeness (TeR) = 4; Geographical representativeness (GR) = 2; Time-related representativeness (TiR) = 1; Precision (P material) = 1; Precision (P processing) = 1

Time period: Inventory data based on 2023 " Plein Pot Sur les Emballages " (PPSE) data (data from ADEME and Open Food Facts)

Use of "PPSE" data to improve packaging modelling for products not covered by the "PACK AGB" project. Data verified by CTCPA's packaging expert.

General assumptions

For "PPSE" missing data, assumptions are based on CTCPA expertise 
Some multi-layer packaging (identified by CTCPA's expert) are modeled using a packaging solution from PACK AGB project. Nota bene the packaging format may be different.

Assumptions at each stage: 

Production
- Only the packaging material in contact with the product or ensuring the product's shelf life is modeled.
For example, in the case of cookies packaged in PP plastic bags (element 1), themselves packaged in a cardboard box (elements 2): (i) Element 2 is the heaviest / (ii) Element 1 is in contact with the product, so the PP material was taken into account.
- For multi-element and multi-layer packaging, the inventory calls for the material in contact with the product and for the quantity, an assumption has been made to take of the packaging solution (sum of all elements) and consider this value for this material.
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative material.

Processing
- Only the most representative process for the most representative packaging material is included.
For example, in the case of a multi-layer flexible film, only the extrusion process is modeled. The lamination process used to combine the various packaging layers was not included. 
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used for the most representative process.

Transport
- The assumptions of the PACK AGB project were applied
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material
- Ratios from France and Europe compiled in the PACK AGB project by packaging material were used (ADEME data, 2020).

End of life
- All plastic packaging is considered non-recycled (R2=0%).
To be able to affirm that the plastic packaging is recycled, it is necessary to consider the whole packaging solution (with all the elements and materials) and in this project the dataset only include a part of the packaging (proxy)
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material. 
- The Circular FootPrint Formula was applied.

The packaging solution describes a PEHD 33cL bottle with aluminium lid, PEHD stopper and paper label.
The data was produced from study of packaging on the French market (supermarket reference) and data collection from manufacturers. 
The inventory includes : (1) production of packaging materials***, (2) manufacture and finishing of packaging components, (3) intermediate transport from the production of materials to the packaging site, and (4) the end-of-life management of packaging*** as it takes place in France. ***Application of CCF, rate of virgin and recycled materials corresponding to the FR scenario (2022) 
The inventory does not include distribution transport (integrated into the next stage at distribution in AGRIBALYSE)

Time period: the data describing the packaging solution was collected over the period 2020-2022.

comment:

Included processes: The inventory includes : The inventory includes: all activities of a poultry farm, that is (1) all inputs as livestock (young animal), feeds, water (watering and clenaning), fuels and energy used for the hatchery as well as the transport to the farm; (2) the buildings and barns; (3) emissions due to the effluent management. 
The border of the inventory is from the birth of the animal to its leaving of the farm.
Cut-off rule, exclusion : The inventory does not include vet products and cares, artificial insemination process, small cleaning material and all processes occuring outside of the farm (slaughtering, processing, conservation etc).
Refers to 1 kg of egg or 1 kg (live weight) of cull hen.
Allocation: Allocation to the coproducts egg and cull hen has been performed using the biophysical allocation approach. Eggs : 100% of the laying hens stage. Cull hens : 100% of the future reproductives, reproductives and young hens stages.

The inventory includes : (1) only the main packaging material (in contact with the product) ; (2) the transport for packaging supply (ratio FR and ratio RER) ; (3) only the main process ; (4) the end of life of the main packaging material.

Functional unit: 1kg of packaged food product

The packaging solutions mentioned as PROXY PACK have been developed with a simplified approach but are based on datasets from PACK-AGB project. These datasets have not been developed for use in comparative LCAs of packaging solutions: if this is your purpose, we recommend that you follow the ADEME reference framework on comparative comparative LCA between different packaging solutions: https://librairie.ademe.fr/dechets-economie-circulaire/5309-cadre-de-reference-acv-comparatives-entre-differentes-solutions-d-emballages.html

Overall data quality : DQR= 2,25; Technological representativeness (TeR) = 1; Geographical representativeness (GR) = 2; Time-related representativeness (TiR) = 5; Precision (P material) = 1; Precision (P processing) = 1

Time period: Inventory data based on 2023 " Plein Pot Sur les Emballages " (PPSE) data (data from ADEME and Open Food Facts)

Use of "PPSE" data to improve packaging modelling for products not covered by the "PACK AGB" project. Data verified by CTCPA's packaging expert.

General assumptions

For "PPSE" missing data, assumptions are based on CTCPA expertise 
Some multi-layer packaging (identified by CTCPA's expert) are modeled using a packaging solution from PACK AGB project. Nota bene the packaging format may be different.

Assumptions at each stage: 

Production
- Only the packaging material in contact with the product or ensuring the product's shelf life is modeled.
For example, in the case of cookies packaged in PP plastic bags (element 1), themselves packaged in a cardboard box (elements 2): (i) Element 2 is the heaviest / (ii) Element 1 is in contact with the product, so the PP material was taken into account.
- For multi-element and multi-layer packaging, the inventory calls for the material in contact with the product and for the quantity, an assumption has been made to take of the packaging solution (sum of all elements) and consider this value for this material.
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative material.

Processing
- Only the most representative process for the most representative packaging material is included.
For example, in the case of a multi-layer flexible film, only the extrusion process is modeled. The lamination process used to combine the various packaging layers was not included. 
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used for the most representative process.

Transport
- The assumptions of the PACK AGB project were applied
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material
- Ratios from France and Europe compiled in the PACK AGB project by packaging material were used (ADEME data, 2020).

End of life
- All plastic packaging is considered non-recycled (R2=0%).
To be able to affirm that the plastic packaging is recycled, it is necessary to consider the whole packaging solution (with all the elements and materials) and in this project the dataset only include a part of the packaging (proxy)
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material. 
- The Circular FootPrint Formula was applied.

AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.
original ecoinvent name: Cucumber {GLO}| cucumber production, in heated greenhouse | Cut-off, U

This dataset represents cucumber production according to the Integrated Production standard in CH.

Yield: 200 t / ha.

Duration of one cropping cycle: 4.9 months.

Greenhouse production.

The LCA study, from which this LCI has been derived, contains detailed descriptions of the system boundaries and the data sources used (Stoessel et al. 2012). The publication is published and freely available with comprehensive supporting information:

http://pubs.acs.org/doi/pdf/10.1021/es2030577

Franziska Stoessel, Ronnie Juraske, Stephan Pfister, Stefanie Hellweg. (2012) Life Cycle Inventory and Carbon and Water FoodPrint of Fruits and Vegetables: Application to a Swiss Retailer. Environmental Science & Technology 6(46) 3253-3262.

None

This activity was adapted to include the global average land use change (LUC) emissions according 2nd edition of the Quantis-modified tool developed by Blonk Consultants 'WFLDB-adapted-Blonk 2014 direct-land-use-change-assessment-tool_2015-05-18a.xlsx', tab. 'Country & land use unknown'. The size of the emission depends on (i) the relative crop expansion in all countries of the crop during the last 20 years and (ii) the corresponding, country specific land transformations. The current results are based on the average FAOSTAT data (harvested area) of 2009-2011 and 1989-1991. The weighted average is used which takes into account relative difference in crop expansion into primary forest, secondary forest, grassland, perennial and annual land.

Production volume: 57559834624 kg
Included activities start: From seedling production.
Included activities end: This activity ends with harvest and storage. 
The dataset includes a storage period of 0.3 month and it's use of electricity. It also includes the electricity use in the greenhouse. And an average amount of heating energy for the production and the seedling production is included. The pesticide inputs are classified according to their chemical classes and the emmssions are assigned to the soil (100%). Mercury emissions are neglected due to a lack of data while other heavy metal emissions are included.  
The dataset doesn't include infrastructure for production and storage facilities. No transports for agricultural means of production from the regional storage to the farm are included.
Energy values: Undefined
Geography: The inventory is modelled for Global
Technology level: Current
Technology: Integrated production

End date: 31/12/2022
Is data valid for entire period: True

activityName: Mango, at farm (WFLDB)
comment:
Reference flow: The functional unit is the production of 1kg of mango. The reference flow is the average yield per ha per year, from 2000 - 2016 (7.7 t/ha) produced under irrigated conditions (13170 m3/ha total water use). 

Allocation: No allocation

System boundaries: Cradle-to-gate. The inventory includes the processes of seedling production and planting, fertiliser and pesticide application, irrigation and harvest. Equipment infrastructure is also considered, such as for sprinkler irrigation. Direct field emissions from crop production activities (e.g. fertiliser and pesticide use) and land use change are included. Post-harvest hot water treatment is excluded. No mechanization is assumed: all field work is manual. 

Data quality rating (DQR) = 2.2, Good quality

Geography: India

Technology: Conventional production in traditional farm (63 trees/acre, 35 years lifespan) is considered. The management of mango orchards tends to be shifting into more intensive production.

Time: 2000 - 2016

Data sources: 
- Yield: FAOstats, average over the years 2012-2016
- Tree density and fertilisation: http://nhb.gov.in/report_files/mango/mango.htm and http://nhb.gov.in/pdf/fruits/mango/man007.pdf accessed on October 2018
- Pesticide: Agribalyse data for conventional mango production in Brazil used as proxy (proportioned to the number of trees)

activityName: Almonds, in shell, at farm {CN} - Adapted from WFLDB U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024. 
This dataset has been adapted for Agribalyse 3.2.
- Background Ecoinvent data have been updated to Ecoinvent 3.9.1
_________________________________
"Translated name: Almonds, at farm (WFLDB 3.5)
Included processes: The inventory includes all activities of a year in the productive phase of the orchard, i.e. fertiliser and pesticide application, mowing, harvesting, irrigation and prune in winter. Machine infrastructure including a shed for shelter and fuel use are also considered as well as transport on the farm. Direct field emissions from crop production activities and from land use change are considered. The establishment phase of the orchard, i.e. tree nursery, soil cultivation, planting trees, sowing grass, installation of irrigation. Fertiliser and pesticide use in a year of the establishment phase is assumed to be half of the amount of a year in the productive phase. No processing included (hulling and shelling). 
Remark: The functional unit is the production of 1 kg of almonds. The reference flow is the average Yield_ per ha and year for the reference period of 2009 - 2012: Yield_ (2.9 t/ha) obtained under irrigated conditions (total amount of water 2133 m3/ha). System boundary: an average year of the productive phase is regarded

activityName: Cocoa bean {ID}| cocoa bean production, sun-dried | Cut-off, U
comment:
This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of cocoa beans. The reference flow is the average yield per ha and year, from 2009 - 2012: yield (493 kg/ha) obtained under non-irrigated conditions. The data are representative for cocoa beans production in Indonesia used for the export market. Mineral NPK fertiliser input is 66-88-55 kg/ha. No organic fertilisers are applied. Total active ingredients (a.i.) applied as pesticides amount to 7.7 kg a.i./ha.

The dataset was modelled within the project 'World Food LCA database (WFLDB)'. The aim of this project was to provide inventories of a broad variety of agricultural products and processes and to cover for each product at least 50% of the global export market. The export share of cocoa beans produced in Indonesia amounts to 16 % of the global export (tonnage exported in 2010). The production system regarded in this dataset aimed at representing cocoa beans produced Indonesia for the export market. 

PEF-Quality: data quality rating (DQR) = 2.2 (i.e. good quality). This dataset refers to an average situation; for specific situations exchanges might differ substantially due to site specific parameters

Production volume: 7.7672725E8 kg
Included activities start: This activity starts with the nursery producing fruit tree seedlings, i.e.grafted young trees to be planted.
Included activities end: This activity ends with the waste treatment after the clearing of the orchard (rooting up the trees). The dataset includes all activities during a year in the productive phase of the orchard including the establishment phase per year of lifetime (50 years), the clearing of the orchard including waste treatment. 
The establishment phase of the orchard includes tree nursery, soil cultivation, planting trees, sowing grass and irrigation. Fertiliser and pesticide use in a year of the establishment phase is assumed to be half of the amount of a year in the productive phase.
The productive phase of the orchard includes fertiliser and pesticide application, harvesting and irrigation. Machine use and infrastructure are excluded as most of the work is assumed to be manual work. Further, direct field emissions and land use change are included. At the end of the productive phase the orchard is cleared by rooting up the trees. On-site fermentation and sun-drying of the cocoa beans are included.
Waste treatment after the clearing of the orchard includes the incineration of tree wood. The inputs of seedlings, fertilisers and pesticides as well as packaging of fertilisers and pesticides are considered.  Heavy metal uptake by the crop is considered.
Geography: The inventory is modelled for Indonesia
Technology level: Current
Technology: Conventional production
Start date: 01/01/2009
End date: 31/12/2024
Is data valid for entire period: True
Macro-economic scenario name: Business-as-Usual

activityName: Tartinables, 150g | Packaging System, Proxy Pack, Rigid plastic, other than bottles {FR} U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.

The inventory includes : (1) only the main packaging material (in contact with the product) ; (2) the transport for packaging supply (ratio FR and ratio RER) ; (3) only the main process ; (4) the end of life of the main packaging material.

Functional unit: 1kg of packaged food product

The packaging solutions mentioned as PROXY PACK have been developed with a simplified approach but are based on datasets from PACK-AGB project. These datasets have not been developed for use in comparative LCAs of packaging solutions: if this is your purpose, we recommend that you follow the ADEME reference framework on comparative comparative LCA between different packaging solutions: https://librairie.ademe.fr/dechets-economie-circulaire/5309-cadre-de-reference-acv-comparatives-entre-differentes-solutions-d-emballages.html

Overall data quality : DQR= 1,25; Technological representativeness (TeR) = 1; Geographical representativeness (GR) = 2; Time-related representativeness (TiR) = 1; Precision (P material) = 1; Precision (P processing) = 1

Time period: Inventory data based on 2023 " Plein Pot Sur les Emballages " (PPSE) data (data from ADEME and Open Food Facts)

Use of "PPSE" data to improve packaging modelling for products not covered by the "PACK AGB" project. Data verified by CTCPA's packaging expert.

General assumptions

For "PPSE" missing data, assumptions are based on CTCPA expertise 
Some multi-layer packaging (identified by CTCPA's expert) are modeled using a packaging solution from PACK AGB project. Nota bene the packaging format may be different.

Assumptions at each stage: 

Production
- Only the packaging material in contact with the product or ensuring the product's shelf life is modeled.
For example, in the case of cookies packaged in PP plastic bags (element 1), themselves packaged in a cardboard box (elements 2): (i) Element 2 is the heaviest / (ii) Element 1 is in contact with the product, so the PP material was taken into account.
- For multi-element and multi-layer packaging, the inventory calls for the material in contact with the product and for the quantity, an assumption has been made to take of the packaging solution (sum of all elements) and consider this value for this material.
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative material.

Processing
- Only the most representative process for the most representative packaging material is included.
For example, in the case of a multi-layer flexible film, only the extrusion process is modeled. The lamination process used to combine the various packaging layers was not included. 
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used for the most representative process.

Transport
- The assumptions of the PACK AGB project were applied
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material
- Ratios from France and Europe compiled in the PACK AGB project by packaging material were used (ADEME data, 2020).

End of life
- All plastic packaging is considered non-recycled (R2=0%).
To be able to affirm that the plastic packaging is recycled, it is necessary to consider the whole packaging solution (with all the elements and materials) and in this project the dataset only include a part of the packaging (proxy)
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material. 
- The Circular FootPrint Formula was applied.

Générateurs : CTCPA
Vérificateurs : CTCPA (packaging expert from CTCPA)
Contact : Pauline AUDOYE (paudoye@ctcpa.org) ; Mathilde BRAMBATI (mbrambati@ctcpa.org) ; Margaux COLOMBIN(mcolombin@ctcpa.org)
Property rights : OpenData, licence "Ecolab".  
Propriété : ADEME

activityName: Pork, 710g | Packaging System, N0, All, EPS Tray with film {FR} U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.

N0, all Identification key for packaging system containing one or more element.
EPS refers to Material expanded polystyrene (EPS)
For more information, please refer to the methodological report  : Colombin, M., Audoye, P., Farrant, L., Allain, D., Anneraud, C., Bosque, F., Besnier, A., Bozec, A.(2024). Rapport méthodologique : volet emballages Agribalyse 3.2.

The inventory refers to a "EPS tray" and the associated elements allowing to condition a weight between 300g and 1,1kg of pork. 
Application to other cases: This inventory of packaging solution can only be used for products in sub-category "Pork" (PACK_AGB) : refer to the report for more details. This inventory cannot be used to represent the same type of packaging for other products outside the sub-category "Pork" (PACK_AGB).

The data was produced from study of packaging on the French market (supermarket reference), weighing of eight references and CTCPA packaging expertise.
Eight references were weighed to best represent the French market. They are all packed and marketed under store brand.
The weight of 710g of product used was obtained by averaging eight references. The weight of the packaging corresponds to the average of the weighed packaging.

The inventory includes : (1) production of packaging materials***, (2) manufacture and finishing of packaging components, (3) intermediate transport from the production of materials to the packaging site, and (4) the end-of-life management of packaging*** as it takes place in France. ***Application of CCF, rate of virgin and recycled materials corresponding to the FR scenario (2022) 
The inventory does not include distribution transport (integrated into the next stage at distribution in AGRIBALYSE).

The packaging solutions developed as part of the PACK_AGB project have not been developed for use in comparative LCAs of packaging solutions: if this is your purpose, we recommend that you follow the ADEME reference framework on comparative comparative LCA between different packaging solutions: https://librairie.ademe.fr/dechets-economie-circulaire/5309-cadre-de-reference-acv-comparatives-entre-differentes-solutions-d-emballages.html .

Overall data quality : DQR= 1,25; Technological representativeness (TeR) = 1; Geographical representativeness (GR) = 2; Time-related representativeness (TiR) = 1; Precision (P material) = 1; Precision (P processing) = 1
Time period: the data describing the packaging solution was collected over the period 2020-2022. 
The inventory is modelled for France. Packaging waste management is representative of packaging waste management in France. 
Property rights : OpenData, licence "Ecolab".  
Property data : ADEME

activityName: Sugar, from sugarcane, at sugar refinery {GLO} - Adapted from WFLDB U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024. 
This dataset has been adapted for Agribalyse 3.2.
- Background Ecoinvent data have been updated to Ecoinvent 3.9.1
_________________________________
Reference flow: This multi-output process covers the production of sugar from sugarcane (0.1223 kg), and, as co-products, the production of bagasse from sugarcane (0.0191 kg), ethanol from sugarcane fermentation (0.0090 kg) and vinasse from sugarcane fermentation (0.0938 kg). The functional unit is the production of 1 kg sugar from sugarcane.

Allocation: Based on economic allocation: sugar (84.3%), bagasse (0.3%), ethanol (4.6%) and vinasse (10.8%). Allocation is done according to carbon balance for CO2 emissions.

System Boundaries: Cradle-to-gate. This multi-output process covers the production of sugar, bagasse, ethanol and vinasse. The inventory includes the transport of sugarcane to the sugar refinery and the processing of sugarcane to sugar, ethanol (95% w/w), bagasse (79% dry matter, excess), and vinasse from ethanol production. System boundary is at the sugar refinery. Treatment of waste effluents is not included (most wastewater is spread over the fields nearby). Packaging is not included.

Data quality rating (DQR) = 3.0, Good quality

Geography: Global average, extrapolated from Brazilian practice.

Technology: Juice extraction is performed through milling (not diffusion). The juice is then purified and crystallized to sugar according to standard processes. Ethanol is produced by standard fermentation and distillation techniques. Energy supply is done by combustion of the bagasse resulting from the extraction stage. The two main products are sugar and ethanol.

Time: Data from 1994 to 2006, current technology for the production of ethanol from sugarcane

Data sources:
- Weidema B.P., Bauer C., Hischier R., Mutel C., Nemecek T., Reinhard J., Vadenbo C.O., Wernet G. (2013). Overview and methodology. Data quality guideline for the ecoinvent database version 3. Ecoinvent Report 1(v3). St. Gallen: The ecoinvent Centre

activityName: Sugar, from sugar beet, at sugar refinery {GLO} - Adapted from WFLDB U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024. 
This dataset has been adapted for Agribalyse 3.2.
- Background Ecoinvent data have been updated to Ecoinvent 3.9.1
_________________________________
Reference flow: This multi-output process covers the production of sugar from sugar beet (0.1569 kg), and, as co-products, the production of sugar beet pulp (0.2040 kg) and molasses from sugar beet (0.0359 kg). The functional unit is the production of 1 kg sugar from sugar beet.

Allocation: Based on economic allocation with 70.2% to sugar, 27.9% to pulp and 1.9% to molasses.

System Boundaries: Cradle-to-gate. This multi-output process covers the production of sugar, molasses and pulp. The inventory includes the transport of sugar beet to the sugar refinery, and the processing of sugar beet to sugar, molasses (72% dry matter) and pulp (25.6% dry matter). System boundary is at the sugar refinery. Treatment of waste effluents is included. Packaging of the sugar is not included.

Data quality rating (DQR) = 2.7, Good quality

Geography: Global average, extrapolated from Swiss practice.

Technology: Sweet juice is extracted from the sugar beets by diffusion. The juice is then purified and crystallized to sugar. Molasses come as a by-product of the crystallization process.

Time: Data from 1998 to 2005, typical technology for the production of sugar from sugar beet

Data sources:
- Weidema B.P., Bauer C., Hischier R., Mutel C., Nemecek T., Reinhard J., Vadenbo C.O., Wernet G. (2013). Overview and methodology. Data quality guideline for the ecoinvent database version 3. Ecoinvent Report 1(v3). St. Gallen: The ecoinvent Centre

activityName: Palm date, conditioned and dried {GLO}| palm date production, conditioned and dried | Cut-off, U - Copied from Ecoinvent U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.
original ecoinvent name: Palm date, conditioned and dried {GLO}| palm date production, conditioned and dried | Cut-off, U

This dataset represents 1 kg of palm date fruit conditioned and dried in Tunisia. All the exchanges are calculated per kg of palm date and are based on field data from the main industrial palm date exporter in Tunisia. The inventory includes the following activities: sorting, washing, fumigating, cooling, heating, drying and glucosing. The packaging has not been taking into account.Regarding waste management, palm date kernel are recovered as animal feed. The annual productivity of the plant is 13000 tons of palm dates Deglet Noor (97% of the plam dates are conventionals). The cultivar of the dates studies is Deglet Noor. Tunisia is the world's largest exporter of Deglet Noor.

Production volume: 5574121 kg
Included activities start: The activity starts when palm date fruit arrives to the plant in order to be conditioned.
Included activities end: The activity ends when the fruit has undergone all processing steps. The palm date is then ready to  be packed and send to the importing country. The facility, the infrastructures and the machineries has not been taking into account.
Energy values: Undefined
Geography: The inventory is modelled for Global
Technology level: Current
Technology: 
Start date: 01/01/2012
End date: 31/12/2022
Is data valid for entire period: True
Time period: 
Macro-economic scenario name: Business-as-Usual

comment:
This process is no longer part of the ecoinvent 3 database and will not be updated. Please choose another process.

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of potatoes (fresh matter). The yield is 41001 kg/ha at a moisture content at storage of 78%.

Production volume: 19165865984 kg
Included activities start: This activity starts after the harvest of the previous crop. The inputs of seeds, mineral fertilisers, pesticides and irrigation water are considered. It is assumed that no organic fertilisers are applied.
Included activities end: The dataset includes all machine operations and corresponding machine infrastructure and sheds. Machine operations are: soil cultivation, sowing, fertilisation, irrigation, weed control, pest and pathogen control, harvest, transport from field to farm (1 km) and grading of potatoes. Further, direct field emissions are included. This activity ends after harvest and drying of grains at the farm gate.
Energy values: Undefined
Geography: The inventory is modelled for United States
Technology level: Current
Technology: Conventional production typical for the country. Water for irrigation is pumped from 48 meter depth by electric pumps.
Start date: 01/01/2001
End date: 31/12/2022
Is data valid for entire period: True
Time period: The yield data have been collected for the years 2001-2006.
Macro-economic scenario name: Business-as-Usual

activityName: Quinoa, intensive production, at farm {PE} - Adapted from WFLDB U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024. 
This dataset has been adapted for Agribalyse 3.2.
- Background Ecoinvent data have been updated to Ecoinvent 3.9.1
_________________________________
Reference flow: The functional unit is the production of 1 kg of Quinoa at the farm, with standard water content (13.28%). Average Yield_ per hectare and year: 4.15 t/ha, obtained under irrigated conditions. 

Allocation: No allocation

System boundaries: Cradle-to-gate. The study collected data from 20 farms. In this region, the quinoa is produced on a yearly rotation with quinoa cultivated during the winter and another crop during the summer (e.g., pumpkin, onion, maize, etc.). Machinery is used only for primary tillage (ploughing), secondary tillage (disc harrow) and for the furrowing. Sowing is handled manually. Fertilizers are used and applied by fertigation through the drip irrigation system. Herbicides are applied before sowing, then insecticides and fungicides, as well as pH correctors and growth regulators. Pesticides are considered to be applied by small sprayers and manually. The  harvest is done by hand and then the quinoa is dried in the sun. The threshing is done mechanically by a rice tresher with container capacity of 850 kg. The straw is usually reincorportated in the field or can be burned (depending on what is the following crop cultivated). Reincorporation is assumed in the current dataset and handled mechanically. LUC is included. 

Data quality rating (DQR) = 1.2, Excellent quality

Geography: Peru, region of Arequipa (Majes)

Technology: Conventional production with medium inputs and mechanization level. This production is mostly for export market. 

Time: 2016-2017

Data sources: 
- Latorre Farfan 2017: Latorre Farfan J P, Kristensen I S, Jacobsen S E, 2017. Is quinoa cultivation on the coastal desert of Peru sustainable? A case study from Makes, Arequipa. Master thesis in Agro Environmental Management, Department of Agroecology, Aarhus University. Downloaded on https://library.au.dk/fileadmin/user_upload/Thesis_Jean_Paul_AEM_201402558.pdf, August 2019.

activityName: Rice, basmati {IN}| rice production, basmati | Cut-off, U - Adapted from Ecoinvent U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.
original ecoinvent name: Rice, basmati {IN}| rice production, basmati | Cut-off, U

Adaptation for Agribalyse :
Water for irrigation and water emission to air and water is updated according to Ecoinvent 3.10 process
_________________________________

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of Rice Basmati during May- October, 2016 at a farm located in Village-Sawant, District-Kurukshetra of Harayana. In this area, fields are irrigated with ground water using electric pump for surface irrigation. The farm has a Yield_ of 4000 kg fresh matter per ha for this crop cycle. Sowing date for the crop is 29-July, 2016 and harvesting date is 02-October, 2016. Mineral NPK fertilizer input is 137.5-57.5-84 kg/ha. Herbicides used has active ingredient of Butachlor 750g/ha, Insecticides used has active ingredients of Chlorpyrifos 500g/ha, Chlorantraniliprole 4.8g/ha, and Fenpropathrin 775g/ha. Active ingredient proxies used are: Alachlor for Butachlor, Clothianidin for Chlorantraniliprole, and Deltamethrin for Fenpropathrin. Machinery is used only for soil cultivation with fuel consumption of 44.93 kg/ha using plough, rotary cultivator for soil tillage and other activities.

Production volume: 8769999872 kg
Included activities start: This activity starts about four weeks after the harvest of the previous crop. The soil is prepared for cultivation in first week of May and sowing of seeds started about eight weeks after soil preparation. Thereafter the crop is mature for harvesting in about 3 months.
Included activities end: The activity ends with the harvesting of the mature Basmati Rice plant. Thereafter the field is prepared for cultivation of the next crop.
Energy values: Undefined
Geography: The inventory is modelled for India
Technology level: Current
Technology: Cultivation of Rice Basmati follows conventional production standards
Start date: 01/01/2015
End date: 31/12/2022
Is data valid for entire period: True
Time period: Soil cultivating date for the main crop: 04-May, 2016; Harvesting date main crop: 02-October, 2016. The soil cultivation, sowing and harvesting dates are taken as the middle date of the week or fortnight told to the data collector by the farmer. Total time from date of sowing to date of harvesting comes to 100 days.  The data is collected for one crop cycle. The cycle of one year is considered for entry in ecoeditor.
Macro-economic scenario name: Business-as-Usual

comment:

Included processes: The inventory includes : (1) the processes applied in this phase, this is weed control, fertilisation, pest and pathogen control, grinding, harvest; (2) the machines and shed or surface used to park them; (3) all inputs asfertilizers (mineral and organic), active substances, water for irrigation, fuels as well as the transport to the farm; (4) the direct emissions of the fuel combustion, the abrasion of tyres and the direct emissions on the field.

activityName: Vanilla, 10g | Packaging System, Proxy Pack, Glass {FR} U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.

The inventory includes : (1) only the main packaging material (in contact with the product) ; (2) the transport for packaging supply (ratio FR and ratio RER) ; (3) only the main process ; (4) the end of life of the main packaging material.

Functional unit: 1kg of packaged food product

The packaging solutions mentioned as PROXY PACK have been developed with a simplified approach but are based on datasets from PACK-AGB project. These datasets have not been developed for use in comparative LCAs of packaging solutions: if this is your purpose, we recommend that you follow the ADEME reference framework on comparative comparative LCA between different packaging solutions: https://librairie.ademe.fr/dechets-economie-circulaire/5309-cadre-de-reference-acv-comparatives-entre-differentes-solutions-d-emballages.html

Overall data quality : DQR= 1,75; Technological representativeness (TeR) = 2; Geographical representativeness (GR) = 2; Time-related representativeness (TiR) = 2; Precision (P material) = 1; Precision (P processing) = 1

Time period: Inventory data based on 2023 " Plein Pot Sur les Emballages " (PPSE) data (data from ADEME and Open Food Facts)

Use of "PPSE" data to improve packaging modelling for products not covered by the "PACK AGB" project. Data verified by CTCPA's packaging expert.

General assumptions

For "PPSE" missing data, assumptions are based on CTCPA expertise 
Some multi-layer packaging (identified by CTCPA's expert) are modeled using a packaging solution from PACK AGB project. Nota bene the packaging format may be different.

Assumptions at each stage: 

Production
- Only the packaging material in contact with the product or ensuring the product's shelf life is modeled.
For example, in the case of cookies packaged in PP plastic bags (element 1), themselves packaged in a cardboard box (elements 2): (i) Element 2 is the heaviest / (ii) Element 1 is in contact with the product, so the PP material was taken into account.
- For multi-element and multi-layer packaging, the inventory calls for the material in contact with the product and for the quantity, an assumption has been made to take of the packaging solution (sum of all elements) and consider this value for this material.
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative material.

Processing
- Only the most representative process for the most representative packaging material is included.
For example, in the case of a multi-layer flexible film, only the extrusion process is modeled. The lamination process used to combine the various packaging layers was not included. 
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used for the most representative process.

Transport
- The assumptions of the PACK AGB project were applied
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material
- Ratios from France and Europe compiled in the PACK AGB project by packaging material were used (ADEME data, 2020).

End of life
- All plastic packaging is considered non-recycled (R2=0%).
To be able to affirm that the plastic packaging is recycled, it is necessary to consider the whole packaging solution (with all the elements and materials) and in this project the dataset only include a part of the packaging (proxy)
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material. 
- The Circular FootPrint Formula was applied.

Générateurs : CTCPA
Vérificateurs : CTCPA (packaging expert from CTCPA)
Contact : Pauline AUDOYE (paudoye@ctcpa.org) ; Mathilde BRAMBATI (mbrambati@ctcpa.org) ; Margaux COLOMBIN(mcolombin@ctcpa.org)
Property rights : OpenData, licence "Ecolab".  
Propriété : ADEME

activityName: Heat, central or small-scale, natural gas {Europe without Switzerland}| market for heat, central or small-scale, natural gas | Cut-off, S - Copied from Ecoinvent U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.
original ecoinvent name: Heat, central or small-scale, natural gas {Europe without Switzerland}| market for heat, central or small-scale, natural gas | Cut-off, S

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.

This is the market for  'heat, central or small-scale, natural gas', in the geography of Europe without Switzerland.

The shares of heat supplying activities with combined heat and power (CHP) plants and pure heat power plants have been estimated. On a small level, more heat is produced in heat plants than in CHP plants. The shares are assumed to amount to 25% heat from CHP plants and 75% heat from heat plants. The shares of the individual supplying activities do not correspond to reality and will have to be refined in future. 

This product represents heat measured in MJ. The heat is produced through the burning of natural gas in heat and power co-generation units and several types of boilers. The dataset is targeted for central or small-scale heating.

Production volume: 5742101266432 MJ
Included activities start: This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'heat, central or small-scale, natural gas',  within the geography of Europe without Switzerland.
Included activities end: This activity ends with the supply of  heat, central or small-scale, natural gas', to the consumers of this product. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
Energy values: Undefined
Geography: The inventory is modelled for Europe without Switzerland
Technology level: Current
Technology: 
Start date: 01/01/2011
End date: 31/12/2022
Is data valid for entire period: True
Time period: 
Macro-economic scenario name: Business-as-Usual

activityName: electronic component, passive, unspecified//[GLO] market for electronic component, passive, unspecified
Lettuce {GLO}| lettuce production, in heated greenhouse | Cut-off, U
comment:
This dataset represents lettuce production according to the Integrated Production standard in CH.

Yield: 50 t / ha.

Duration of one cropping cycle: 3.4 months.

Greenhouse production.

The LCA study, from which this LCI has been derived, contains detailed descriptions of the system boundaries and the data sources used (Stoessel et al. 2012). The publication is published and freely available with comprehensive supporting information:

http://pubs.acs.org/doi/pdf/10.1021/es2030577

Franziska Stoessel, Ronnie Juraske, Stephan Pfister, Stefanie Hellweg. (2012) Life Cycle Inventory and Carbon and Water FoodPrint of Fruits and Vegetables: Application to a Swiss Retailer. Environmental Science & Technology 6(46) 3253-3262.

This activity was adapted to include the global average land use change (LUC) emissions according 2nd edition of the Quantis-modified tool developed by Blonk Consultants 'WFLDB-adapted-Blonk 2014 direct-land-use-change-assessment-tool_2015-05-18a.xlsx', tab. 'Country & land use unknown'. The size of the emission depends on (i) the relative crop expansion in all countries of the crop during the last 20 years and (ii) the corresponding, country specific land transformations. The current results are based on the average FAOSTAT data (harvested area) of 2009-2011 and 1989-1991. The weighted average is used which takes into account relative difference in crop expansion into primary forest, secondary forest, grassland, perennial and annual land.

Production volume: 2.3622366E10 kg
Included activities start: From seedling production.
Included activities end: This activity ends with harvest and storage. 
The dataset includes a storage period of 0.3 month and it's use of electricity. It also includes the electricity use in the greenhouse. And an average amount of heating energy for the production and the seedling production is included. The pesticide inputs are classified according to their chemical classes and the emmssions are assigned to the soil (100%). Mercury emissions are neglected due to a lack of data while other heavy metal emissions are included. The dataset doesn't include infrastructure for production and storage facilities. No transports for agricultural means of production from the regional storage to the farm are included.
Geography: The inventory is modelled for Global
Technology level: Current
Technology: Integrated Production
Start date: 01/01/2010
End date: 31/12/2024
Is data valid for entire period: True
Macro-economic scenario name: Business-as-Usual

activityName: Capsule/dosettes, 125g | Packaging System, Proxy Pack, Plastic film {FR} U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.

The inventory includes : (1) only the main packaging material (in contact with the product) ; (2) the transport for packaging supply (ratio FR and ratio RER) ; (3) only the main process ; (4) the end of life of the main packaging material.

Functional unit: 1kg of packaged food product

The packaging solutions mentioned as PROXY PACK have been developed with a simplified approach but are based on datasets from PACK-AGB project. These datasets have not been developed for use in comparative LCAs of packaging solutions: if this is your purpose, we recommend that you follow the ADEME reference framework on comparative comparative LCA between different packaging solutions: https://librairie.ademe.fr/dechets-economie-circulaire/5309-cadre-de-reference-acv-comparatives-entre-differentes-solutions-d-emballages.html

Overall data quality : DQR= 2,25; Technological representativeness (TeR) = 1; Geographical representativeness (GR) = 2; Time-related representativeness (TiR) = 5; Precision (P material) = 1; Precision (P processing) = 1

Time period: Inventory data based on 2023 " Plein Pot Sur les Emballages " (PPSE) data (data from ADEME and Open Food Facts)

Use of "PPSE" data to improve packaging modelling for products not covered by the "PACK AGB" project. Data verified by CTCPA's packaging expert.

General assumptions

For "PPSE" missing data, assumptions are based on CTCPA expertise 
Some multi-layer packaging (identified by CTCPA's expert) are modeled using a packaging solution from PACK AGB project. Nota bene the packaging format may be different.

Assumptions at each stage: 

Production
- Only the packaging material in contact with the product or ensuring the product's shelf life is modeled.
For example, in the case of cookies packaged in PP plastic bags (element 1), themselves packaged in a cardboard box (elements 2): (i) Element 2 is the heaviest / (ii) Element 1 is in contact with the product, so the PP material was taken into account.
- For multi-element and multi-layer packaging, the inventory calls for the material in contact with the product and for the quantity, an assumption has been made to take of the packaging solution (sum of all elements) and consider this value for this material.
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative material.

Processing
- Only the most representative process for the most representative packaging material is included.
For example, in the case of a multi-layer flexible film, only the extrusion process is modeled. The lamination process used to combine the various packaging layers was not included. 
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used for the most representative process.

Transport
- The assumptions of the PACK AGB project were applied
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material
- Ratios from France and Europe compiled in the PACK AGB project by packaging material were used (ADEME data, 2020).

End of life
- All plastic packaging is considered non-recycled (R2=0%).
To be able to affirm that the plastic packaging is recycled, it is necessary to consider the whole packaging solution (with all the elements and materials) and in this project the dataset only include a part of the packaging (proxy)
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material. 
- The Circular FootPrint Formula was applied.

Vérificateurs : CTCPA (packaging expert from CTCPA)
Contact : Pauline AUDOYE (paudoye@ctcpa.org) ; Mathilde BRAMBATI (mbrambati@ctcpa.org) ; Margaux COLOMBIN(mcolombin@ctcpa.org)
Property rights : OpenData, licence "Ecolab".  
Propriété : ADEME

activityName: Pear, at farm (WFLDB)
comment:
Translated name: Pear, at farm (WFLDB 3.5)
Included processes: The inventory includes all activities of a year in the productive phase of the orchard, i.e. fertiliser and pesticide application, mulching, mowing, harvesting and irrigation. Machine infrastructure including a shed for shelter and fuel use are also considered as well as transport on the farm. Direct field emissions from crop production activities and from land use change are considered. The establishment phase of the orchard, i.e. tree nursery, soil cultivation, planting trees, sowing grass and irrigation. Fertiliser and pesticide use in a year of the establishment phase is assumed to be half of the amount of a year in the productive phase. 
Remark: The functional unit is the production of 1 kg of pear. The reference flow is the average yield per ha and year for the reference period of 2009 - 2012: yield (13.9 t/ha) obtained under irrigated conditions (total amount of water 11085 m3/ha). System boundary: an average year of the productive phase is regarded; included are also the per year of lifetime calculated emissions for nursery, materials for planting, establishment and clearing phase; at farm without storage. Number of years from planting to clearing (lifetime): 20 years   - Waste treatment after clearing of the orchard: Wooden posts and tree wood go to incineration, concrete posts go to land fill, iron wires go to recycling. The data are representative for pear production in China used for the export market.
Comment: Statistical data from FAO used to assess land use change is incomplete for China. The original land use of 40.9% of annual cropland and 100% of perennial cropland transformed in the last 20 years is unknown. Land use change impacts may therefore be underestimated.

Data quality rating (DQR) = 2.8 (i.e. good quality)

comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.

The inventory includes : (1) only the main packaging material (in contact with the product) ; (2) the transport for packaging supply (ratio FR and ratio RER) ; (3) only the main process ; (4) the end of life of the main packaging material.

Functional unit: 1kg of packaged food product

The packaging solutions mentioned as PROXY PACK have been developed with a simplified approach but are based on datasets from PACK-AGB project. These datasets have not been developed for use in comparative LCAs of packaging solutions: if this is your purpose, we recommend that you follow the ADEME reference framework on comparative comparative LCA between different packaging solutions: https://librairie.ademe.fr/dechets-economie-circulaire/5309-cadre-de-reference-acv-comparatives-entre-differentes-solutions-d-emballages.html

Overall data quality : DQR= 1,25; Technological representativeness (TeR) = 1; Geographical representativeness (GR) = 2; Time-related representativeness (TiR) = 1; Precision (P material) = 1; Precision (P processing) = 1

Time period: Inventory data based on 2023 " Plein Pot Sur les Emballages " (PPSE) data (data from ADEME and Open Food Facts)

Use of "PPSE" data to improve packaging modelling for products not covered by the "PACK AGB" project. Data verified by CTCPA's packaging expert.

General assumptions

For "PPSE" missing data, assumptions are based on CTCPA expertise 
Some multi-layer packaging (identified by CTCPA's expert) are modeled using a packaging solution from PACK AGB project. Nota bene the packaging format may be different.

Assumptions at each stage: 

Production
- Only the packaging material in contact with the product or ensuring the product's shelf life is modeled.
For example, in the case of cookies packaged in PP plastic bags (element 1), themselves packaged in a cardboard box (elements 2): (i) Element 2 is the heaviest / (ii) Element 1 is in contact with the product, so the PP material was taken into account.
- For multi-element and multi-layer packaging, the inventory calls for the material in contact with the product and for the quantity, an assumption has been made to take of the packaging solution (sum of all elements) and consider this value for this material.
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative material.

Processing
- Only the most representative process for the most representative packaging material is included.
For example, in the case of a multi-layer flexible film, only the extrusion process is modeled. The lamination process used to combine the various packaging layers was not included. 
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used for the most representative process.

Transport
- The assumptions of the PACK AGB project were applied
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material
- Ratios from France and Europe compiled in the PACK AGB project by packaging material were used (ADEME data, 2020).

End of life
- All plastic packaging is considered non-recycled (R2=0%).
To be able to affirm that the plastic packaging is recycled, it is necessary to consider the whole packaging solution (with all the elements and materials) and in this project the dataset only include a part of the packaging (proxy)
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material. 
- The Circular FootPrint Formula was applied.

comment:

activityName: Crackers, 100g | Packaging System, Proxy Pack, Plastic film {FR} U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.

The inventory includes : (1) only the main packaging material (in contact with the product) ; (2) the transport for packaging supply (ratio FR and ratio RER) ; (3) only the main process ; (4) the end of life of the main packaging material.

Functional unit: 1kg of packaged food product

The packaging solutions mentioned as PROXY PACK have been developed with a simplified approach but are based on datasets from PACK-AGB project. These datasets have not been developed for use in comparative LCAs of packaging solutions: if this is your purpose, we recommend that you follow the ADEME reference framework on comparative comparative LCA between different packaging solutions: https://librairie.ademe.fr/dechets-economie-circulaire/5309-cadre-de-reference-acv-comparatives-entre-differentes-solutions-d-emballages.html

Overall data quality : DQR= 2; Technological representativeness (TeR) = 4; Geographical representativeness (GR) = 2; Time-related representativeness (TiR) = 1; Precision (P material) = 1; Precision (P processing) = 1

Time period: Inventory data based on 2023 " Plein Pot Sur les Emballages " (PPSE) data (data from ADEME and Open Food Facts)

Use of "PPSE" data to improve packaging modelling for products not covered by the "PACK AGB" project. Data verified by CTCPA's packaging expert.

General assumptions

For "PPSE" missing data, assumptions are based on CTCPA expertise 
Some multi-layer packaging (identified by CTCPA's expert) are modeled using a packaging solution from PACK AGB project. Nota bene the packaging format may be different.

Assumptions at each stage: 

Production
- Only the packaging material in contact with the product or ensuring the product's shelf life is modeled.
For example, in the case of cookies packaged in PP plastic bags (element 1), themselves packaged in a cardboard box (elements 2): (i) Element 2 is the heaviest / (ii) Element 1 is in contact with the product, so the PP material was taken into account.
- For multi-element and multi-layer packaging, the inventory calls for the material in contact with the product and for the quantity, an assumption has been made to take of the packaging solution (sum of all elements) and consider this value for this material.
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative material.

Processing
- Only the most representative process for the most representative packaging material is included.
For example, in the case of a multi-layer flexible film, only the extrusion process is modeled. The lamination process used to combine the various packaging layers was not included. 
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used for the most representative process.

Transport
- The assumptions of the PACK AGB project were applied
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material
- Ratios from France and Europe compiled in the PACK AGB project by packaging material were used (ADEME data, 2020).

End of life
- All plastic packaging is considered non-recycled (R2=0%).
To be able to affirm that the plastic packaging is recycled, it is necessary to consider the whole packaging solution (with all the elements and materials) and in this project the dataset only include a part of the packaging (proxy)
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material. 
- The Circular FootPrint Formula was applied.

Générateurs : CTCPA
Vérificateurs : CTCPA (packaging expert from CTCPA)
Contact : Pauline AUDOYE (paudoye@ctcpa.org) ; Mathilde BRAMBATI (mbrambati@ctcpa.org) ; Margaux COLOMBIN(mcolombin@ctcpa.org)
Property rights : OpenData, licence "Ecolab".  
Propriété : ADEME

activityName: Sunflower oil, at oil mill {GLO} - Adapted from WFLDB U {{sunflower-oil-oil-mill-glo-adapted-from-wfldb-u-organic}}
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024. 
This dataset has been adapted for Agribalyse 3.2.
- Background Ecoinvent data have been updated to Ecoinvent 3.9.1
_________________________________
"The SALCA process ""Sunflower oil, at oil mill/kg/CH"" is used as a proxy to model Sunflower oil extraction at oil mill. 

Reference flow: Oil Yield_ (unallocated Yield_): 3.31 kg Sunflower seeds are needed for 1 kg Sunflower oil. For Sunflower at farm, the global dataset is used. Sunflower lecithin Yield_s are assumed to be about 0.3% on a seed basis (Nieuwenhuyzen (2014))

Allocation: economic allocation is applied, based on the price ratio between 1 kg oil, 2.3 kg of the co-product Sunflower oil cake and 0.01 kg sunflower lecithin. Price for 1 kg Sunflower oil = 0.72 US $/pound = 1.58 $/kg

activityName: Apple, at farm (WFLDB)
comment:
Included processes: The inventory includes all activities of a year in the productive phase of the orchard, i.e. fertiliser and pesticide application, mulching, harvesting and irrigation. Machine infrastructure including a shed for shelter and fuel use are also considered as well as transport on the farm. Direct field emissions from crop production activities and from land use change are considered. The establishment phase of the orchard, i.e. tree nursery, soil cultivation, planting trees, sowing grass, installation of trellis system (posts and wires) and irrigation. Fertiliser and pesticide use in a year of the establishment phase is assumed to be half of the amount of a year in the productive phase. 
Remark: The functional unit is the production of 1 kg of apples. The reference flow is the average yield per ha and year for the reference period of 2009 - 2012: yield (16.783 t/ha) obtained under irrigated conditions (total amount of water 12249 m3/ha). System boundary: an average year of the productive phase is regarded; included are also the per year of lifetime calculated emissions for nursery, materials for planting, establishment and clearing phase; at farm without storage. Number of years from planting to clearing (lifetime): 15 years   - Waste treatment after clearing of the orchard: Wooden posts and tree wood go to incineration, concrete posts go to land fill, iron wires go to recycling. The data are representative for apple production in China used for the export market.

Data quality rating (DQR) = 2.5 (i.e. good quality)

Technology: Conventional production

activityName: Oats, at farm {GLO} - Adapted from WFLDB U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024. 
This dataset has been adapted for Agribalyse 3.2.
- Background Ecoinvent data have been updated to Ecoinvent 3.9.1
_________________________________
This dataset represents the global average for Oat, at farm. It is calculated as weighted average of the following countries, based on their respective export shares according to FAOSTAT data for 2010:
 - Canada 56%
 - Finland 12%
These countries together represent 68% of global export. 
All farming activities documented in the respective national datasets are included. No transportation to the marketplace is considered.
The functional unit is the production of 1 kg of Oat, at standard water content required for storage of 14%.

Data quality rating (DQR) = 1.8 (i.e. very good quality)

activityName: Coffee/chicory rehydrated with water at consumer step, 200g | Packaging System, Proxy Pack, Glass {FR} U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.

The inventory includes : (1) only the main packaging material (in contact with the product) ; (2) the transport for packaging supply (ratio FR and ratio RER) ; (3) only the main process ; (4) the end of life of the main packaging material.

Functional unit: 1kg of packaged food product

The packaging solutions mentioned as PROXY PACK have been developed with a simplified approach but are based on datasets from PACK-AGB project. These datasets have not been developed for use in comparative LCAs of packaging solutions: if this is your purpose, we recommend that you follow the ADEME reference framework on comparative comparative LCA between different packaging solutions: https://librairie.ademe.fr/dechets-economie-circulaire/5309-cadre-de-reference-acv-comparatives-entre-differentes-solutions-d-emballages.html

Overall data quality : DQR= 1,75; Technological representativeness (TeR) = 2; Geographical representativeness (GR) = 2; Time-related representativeness (TiR) = 2; Precision (P material) = 1; Precision (P processing) = 1

Time period: Inventory data based on 2023 " Plein Pot Sur les Emballages " (PPSE) data (data from ADEME and Open Food Facts)

Use of "PPSE" data to improve packaging modelling for products not covered by the "PACK AGB" project. Data verified by CTCPA's packaging expert.

General assumptions

For "PPSE" missing data, assumptions are based on CTCPA expertise 
Some multi-layer packaging (identified by CTCPA's expert) are modeled using a packaging solution from PACK AGB project. Nota bene the packaging format may be different.

Assumptions at each stage: 

Production
- Only the packaging material in contact with the product or ensuring the product's shelf life is modeled.
For example, in the case of cookies packaged in PP plastic bags (element 1), themselves packaged in a cardboard box (elements 2): (i) Element 2 is the heaviest / (ii) Element 1 is in contact with the product, so the PP material was taken into account.
- For multi-element and multi-layer packaging, the inventory calls for the material in contact with the product and for the quantity, an assumption has been made to take of the packaging solution (sum of all elements) and consider this value for this material.
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative material.

Processing
- Only the most representative process for the most representative packaging material is included.
For example, in the case of a multi-layer flexible film, only the extrusion process is modeled. The lamination process used to combine the various packaging layers was not included. 
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used for the most representative process.

Transport
- The assumptions of the PACK AGB project were applied
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material
- Ratios from France and Europe compiled in the PACK AGB project by packaging material were used (ADEME data, 2020).

End of life
- All plastic packaging is considered non-recycled (R2=0%).
To be able to affirm that the plastic packaging is recycled, it is necessary to consider the whole packaging solution (with all the elements and materials) and in this project the dataset only include a part of the packaging (proxy)
- Datasets created as part of the PACK AGB project were used, for the most representative packaging material. 
- The Circular FootPrint Formula was applied.

Vérificateurs : CTCPA (packaging expert from CTCPA)
Contact : Pauline AUDOYE (paudoye@ctcpa.org) ; Mathilde BRAMBATI (mbrambati@ctcpa.org) ; Margaux COLOMBIN(mcolombin@ctcpa.org)

activityName: Onion {RoW}| onion production | Cut-off, U - Copied from Ecoinvent U
comment:
AGRIBALYSE v3.2 dataset, 2024.
original ecoinvent name: Onion {RoW}| onion production | Cut-off, U

This dataset is a weighted average of the regional datasets, with weights based on production volume of the reference product.  Detailed comments and sources about the exchanges can be found in the regional datasets.

The geographicalCorrelation score of every pedigree matrix of was changed to '5'.

Sum of regional production volumes: 3.971e+10 kg

CN: PV = 2.268e+10 kg; weight = 0.5712

IN: PV = 1.540e+10 kg; weight = 0.3878

NL: PV = 1.402e+9 kg; weight = 0.03531

NZ: PV = 2.245e+8 kg; weight = 5.653e-3

Yield of the global dataset = 43838.9116255 kg/ha, calculated as a weighted average of the regional Yield_s.

The comments below were part of the CN regional dataset.

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of onions The average Yield_ from 2009 - 2010 is 60 t/ha. The data are representative for onion production in China, Gansu province, used for the export market. Mineral NPK fertiliser input is 200-240-75 kg/ha. No organic fertilisers are applied. Total active ingredients (a.i.) applied as pesticides amount to 10.6 kg a.i./ha.

The dataset was modelled within the project 'World Food LCA database (WFLDB)'. The aim of this project was to provide inventories of a broad variety of agricultural products and processes and to cover for each product at least 50% of the global export market. The export share of onions produced in China amounts to 9% of the global export (tonnage exported in 2010). The production system regarded in this dataset aimed at representing onions produced in China for the export market.

PEF-Quality: data quality rating (DQR) = 2.0 (i.e. very good quality). This dataset refers to an average situation; for specific situations exchanges might differ substantially due to site specific parameters

Production volume: 38596923392 kg
Included activities start: This activity starts with the nursery producing seedlings, i.e. seedlings from roots.
Included activities end: This activity ends with the harvest of onions at farm gate. The dataset includes total diesel combusted in agricultural machinery, corresponding infrastructure, fuel use and sheds. Further, direct field emissions and land use change are included. Heavy metal uptake by the crop is considered. The inputs of seeds, fertilisers and pesticides as well as packaging of fertilisers and pesticides are considered. 
Statistical data from FAO used to assess land use change is incomplete for China. The original land use of 40.9% of annual cropland and 100% of perennial cropland transformed in the last 20 years is unknown. Land use change impacts may therefore be underestimated.
Energy values: Undefined
Geography: The inventory is modelled for Rest-of-World
Technology level: Current
Technology: 
Start date: 01/01/2004
End date: 31/12/2022
Is data valid for entire period: True
Time period: 
Macro-economic scenario name: Business-as-Usual
